bite the bullet.meaning: To endure a painful experience or situation (दर्दनाक अनुभव या स्थिति को सहन करना).
bite the bullet.example: Even though he was scared of the injection, he had to bite the bullet and get vaccinated.

break the ice.meaning: To initiate a conversation in a social setting (सामाजिक वातावरण में बातचीत शुरू करना).
break the ice.example: To break the ice, she started talking about the latest movie she watched.

hit the sack.meaning: To go to bed or sleep (सोने जाना).
hit the sack.example: I'm so tired after the long day; it's time to hit the sack.

bring up.meaning: To mention a topic in conversation (किसी विषय को बातचीत में लाना).
bring up.example: She decided to bring up the issue during the meeting.

give up.meaning: To stop trying or surrender (हार मानना या छोड़ देना).
give up.example: After several failed attempts, he decided to give up on learning the guitar.

look after.meaning: To take care of someone or something (किसी का ध्यान रखना).
look after.example: She looks after her younger brother when their parents are at work.

abide by.meaning: To follow or obey a rule, decision, or law (नियम, निर्णय या कानून का पालन करना).
abide by.example: As a responsible citizen, you must abide by the rules of the country.

abound in.meaning: To exist in large numbers or quantities (बहुतायत में होना).
abound in.example: This forest abounds in various species of wildlife.

accede to.meaning: To agree to a request or demand (किसी अनुरोध या मांग को स्वीकार करना).
accede to.example: The government finally acceded to the public’s demand for reforms.

accord with.meaning: To be consistent or in agreement with something (किसी चीज़ से मेल खाना या सहमत होना).
accord with.example: His statement does not accord with the facts.

ace out.meaning: To narrowly defeat someone or succeed in something (किसी को कड़ी टक्कर देकर हराना या सफलता प्राप्त करना).
ace out.example: She aced out her competitors in the final round of the competition.

ache for.meaning: To have a strong desire for something or someone (किसी चीज़ या व्यक्ति के लिए तीव्र इच्छा रखना).
ache for.example: After months of separation, he ached for his family’s company.

act up.meaning: To behave badly or cause trouble (बुरा व्यवहार करना या समस्या पैदा करना).
act up.example: The kids started acting up during the long car ride.

act out.meaning: To express emotions through actions rather than words (भावनाओं को क्रियाओं के माध्यम से व्यक्त करना).
act out.example: He acted out his frustration by slamming the door.

account for.meaning: To explain the reason for something (किसी चीज़ का कारण बताना).
account for.example: She couldn’t account for the missing documents.

add up.meaning: To make sense or be logical (तर्कसंगत होना या समझ में आना).
add up.example: His excuse doesn’t add up; I think he’s lying.

aim at.meaning: To direct efforts towards a goal (किसी लक्ष्य की ओर प्रयास करना).
aim at.example: The campaign aims at raising awareness about climate change.

add up to.meaning: To result in a total amount (किसी कुल राशि में परिणत होना).
add up to.example: The expenses added up to more than expected.

allow for.meaning: To consider or include something when making plans (योजना बनाते समय किसी चीज़ को ध्यान में रखना).
allow for.example: You should allow for some extra time in case of traffic.

adhere to.meaning: To stick firmly to rules, beliefs, or agreements (नियमों, विश्वासों या समझौतों का कड़ाई से पालन करना).
adhere to.example: All employees must adhere to the company policies.

allow of.meaning: To permit or make something possible (किसी चीज़ की अनुमति देना या संभव बनाना).
allow of.example: The situation does not allow of any delay.

adjourn to.meaning: To move to another place after a meeting or gathering (बैठक या सभा के बाद दूसरी जगह जाना).
adjourn to.example: After the discussion, we adjourned to the dining hall.

allude to.meaning: To indirectly refer to something or someone (किसी चीज़ या व्यक्ति का अप्रत्यक्ष रूप से उल्लेख करना).
allude to.example: She alluded to her past experiences without giving details.

agree with.meaning: To have the same opinion as someone or approve of something (किसी से सहमत होना या किसी चीज़ को स्वीकार करना).
agree with.example: I agree with your point about climate change.

amount to.meaning: To be equivalent to or result in a specific outcome (किसी निश्चित परिणाम में परिणत होना या उसके बराबर होना).
amount to.example: His actions amount to a violation of the law.

angle for.meaning: To try to obtain something indirectly (किसी चीज़ को अप्रत्यक्ष रूप से प्राप्त करने की कोशिश करना).
angle for.example: He was angling for a promotion by complimenting his boss frequently.

announce against.meaning: To publicly declare opposition to someone or something (सार्वजनिक रूप से किसी का विरोध करना).
announce against.example: The senator announced against the new tax policy.

announce for.meaning: To declare support for someone or something (किसी के समर्थन की घोषणा करना).
announce for.example: The mayor announced for the new education reforms.

answer back.meaning: To reply rudely to someone in authority (अधिकारियों को अशिष्टता से जवाब देना).
answer back.example: The student was punished for answering back to the teacher.

answer for.meaning: To take responsibility for something (किसी चीज़ की जिम्मेदारी लेना).
answer for.example: You must answer for your actions in the court of law.

answer to.meaning: To be accountable to someone or follow their authority (किसी को जवाबदेह होना या उनके आदेशों का पालन करना).
answer to.example: As an intern, she answers to the department manager.

ante up.meaning: To pay a required amount, often reluctantly (आवश्यक धनराशि का भुगतान करना, आमतौर पर अनिच्छा से).
ante up.example: Each team member had to ante up for the project expenses.

appertain to.meaning: To relate to or be connected with something (किसी चीज़ से संबंधित होना).
appertain to.example: The rules appertain to all employees equally.

arrive at.meaning: To reach a decision or conclusion (किसी निर्णय या निष्कर्ष पर पहुंचना).
arrive at.example: After hours of discussion, they arrived at a compromise.

ascribe to.meaning: To attribute something to a cause or source (किसी चीज़ को किसी कारण या स्रोत से जोड़ना).
ascribe to.example: He ascribed his success to years of hard work.

ask after.meaning: To inquire about someone's well-being (किसी की कुशलता के बारे में पूछताछ करना).
ask after.example: She called to ask after her friend’s health.

ask around.meaning: To ask multiple people for information or help (जानकारी या सहायता के लिए कई लोगों से पूछना).
ask around.example: I don’t know where he is; you should ask around.

ask for.meaning: To request something (किसी चीज़ का अनुरोध करना).
ask for.example: He asked for directions to the nearest hospital.

ask in.meaning: To invite someone into a place (किसी को अंदर आमंत्रित करना).
ask in.example: She asked me in for a cup of coffee.

ask out.meaning: To invite someone on a date (किसी को डेट पर आमंत्रित करना).
ask out.example: He finally gathered the courage to ask her out.

ask over.meaning: To invite someone to your home (किसी को घर पर आमंत्रित करना).
ask over.example: I asked my friends over for dinner.

aspire to.meaning: To aim for or have a strong desire to achieve something (किसी चीज़ को प्राप्त करने की तीव्र इच्छा रखना).
aspire to.example: She aspires to become a successful entrepreneur.

associate with.meaning: To connect or be involved with someone or something (किसी से जुड़ना या संबंधित होना).
associate with.example: Many people associate wealth with happiness.

atone for.meaning: To make amends or compensate for a wrongdoing (किसी गलती या अपराध का प्रायश्चित करना).
atone for.example: He volunteered at a charity to atone for his past mistakes.

auction off.meaning: To sell something to the highest bidder in an auction (नीलामी में किसी वस्तु को सबसे ऊंची बोली लगाने वाले को बेचना).
auction off.example: They auctioned off the old furniture to raise funds.

avail of.meaning: To take advantage of an opportunity or offer (किसी अवसर या प्रस्ताव का लाभ उठाना).
avail of.example: Students can avail of the library’s free resources.

attend to.meaning: To take care of or deal with something (किसी चीज़ की देखभाल करना या ध्यान देना).
attend to.example: The doctor attended to the injured patient immediately.

average out.meaning: To result in an average over a period of time (समय के साथ औसत रूप में परिणत होना).
average out.example: My monthly expenses average out to $500.

attest to.meaning: To confirm the truth or validity of something (किसी चीज़ की सत्यता या वैधता की पुष्टि करना).
attest to.example: His excellent performance attests to his hard work.

attribute to.meaning: To consider something as being caused by someone or something (किसी चीज़ का कारण किसी को ठहराना).
attribute to.example: She attributes her success to years of dedication.

average out at.meaning: To have a final average amount of something (अंत में औसतन किसी निश्चित संख्या पर पहुंचना).
average out at.example: The temperature in summer averages out at 30°C.

back away.meaning: To move away from someone or something, usually because of fear (डर या संकोच के कारण पीछे हटना).
back away.example: She backed away when she saw the aggressive dog.

back down.meaning: To withdraw from a position, argument, or demand (किसी स्थिति, तर्क, या मांग से पीछे हटना).
back down.example: He refused to back down in the debate.

back off.meaning: To stop being aggressive or pressing (पीछे हट जाना, जोर देना बंद करना).
back off.example: The police told the protesters to back off.

back out.meaning: To withdraw from an agreement or commitment (किसी समझौते या वादे से पीछे हटना).
back out.example: He backed out of the deal at the last minute.

back up.meaning: To support someone or something (किसी का समर्थन करना) OR to create a copy of data (डेटा का बैकअप बनाना).
back up.example: She backed up her claim with evidence.

back onto.meaning: To have a back side that faces or touches something (पीछे की तरफ किसी चीज़ से सटा होना).
back onto.example: Their house backs onto a beautiful garden.

bail up.meaning: To stop someone from leaving or delay them (किसी को रोकना या देर करना).
bail up.example: He bailed me up with endless questions.

balance out.meaning: To counteract one effect with another to make things equal (किसी प्रभाव को संतुलित करना).
balance out.example: The expenses and profits balanced out in the end.

bag up.meaning: To put things into a bag (चीजों को बैग में रखना).
bag up.example: She bagged up the groceries at the checkout.

bail out.meaning: To help someone in a difficult situation, often financially (किसी की मदद करना, खासकर वित्तीय संकट में).
bail out.example: The government bailed out the struggling company.

bale out.meaning: To jump out of an aircraft in an emergency (आपातकालीन स्थिति में विमान से कूदना).
bale out.example: The pilot had to bale out before the plane crashed.

balk at.meaning: To hesitate or refuse to do something (किसी चीज़ को करने में हिचकिचाना या मना करना).
balk at.example: He balked at the idea of working overtime.

balls up.meaning: To completely mess up or spoil something (पूरी तरह से गड़बड़ कर देना).
balls up.example: He really balled up the presentation by forgetting his speech.

band together.meaning: To unite for a common purpose (किसी सामान्य उद्देश्य के लिए एकजुट होना).
band together.example: The workers banded together to demand better wages.

bandage up.meaning: To wrap a wound with a bandage (घाव पर पट्टी बांधना).
bandage up.example: The nurse bandaged up his injured arm.

bang out.meaning: To produce something quickly, often without much care (जल्दी-जल्दी कुछ तैयार करना).
bang out.example: He banged out an essay just before the deadline.

bandy about.meaning: To talk about something in a casual or careless way (बिना सोच-विचार के किसी चीज़ पर चर्चा करना).
bandy about.example: Rumors about his resignation were bandied about in the office.

bang up.meaning: To damage or injure something or someone badly (किसी चीज़ को गंभीर रूप से नुकसान पहुंचाना या घायल करना).
bang up.example: He really banged up his car in the accident.

bang about.meaning: To move around noisily, often causing disruption (शोर मचाते हुए इधर-उधर घूमना).
bang about.example: The kids were banging about upstairs all evening.

bang around.meaning: To move in a rough or noisy way (अशांति के साथ इधर-उधर घूमना).
bang around.example: He banged around in the kitchen looking for a snack.

bang away at.meaning: To work hard at something, especially repeatedly (लगातार मेहनत से किसी चीज़ पर काम करना).
bang away at.example: She kept banging away at her novel despite the distractions.

bang on.meaning: To talk continuously and often annoyingly about something (बिना रुके किसी चीज़ के बारे में बोलते रहना).
bang on.example: He kept banging on about his new car.

bang down.meaning: To put something down with force, often angrily (गुस्से में जोर से पटकना).
bang down.example: She banged down the phone after the argument.

bargain for.meaning: To expect or anticipate something (किसी चीज़ की उम्मीद करना).
bargain for.example: I didn’t bargain for such a difficult exam.

bargain on.meaning: To rely on something happening (किसी चीज़ के होने पर निर्भर रहना).
bargain on.example: We hadn’t bargained on the heavy traffic.

bang into.meaning: To crash into something by accident (गलती से किसी चीज़ से टकराना).
bang into.example: He banged into the door while rushing out.

barge in.meaning: To enter a place suddenly and rudely (बिना अनुमति के अचानक प्रवेश करना).

bask in.meaning: To enjoy and take pleasure in something, usually praise or warmth (किसी चीज़ का आनंद लेना, जैसे प्रशंसा या धूप).
bask in.example: She basked in the glory of her success.

bark out.meaning: To say something quickly and sharply (किसी चीज़ को तेज़ और सख्त लहजे में बोलना).
bark out.example: The sergeant barked out orders to the soldiers.

bat around.meaning: To discuss different ideas before making a decision (किसी विचार को लागू करने से पहले उस पर चर्चा करना).
bat around.example: We batted around some ideas for the new project.

base on.meaning: To use something as a foundation or starting point (किसी चीज़ को आधार बनाना).
base on.example: The movie is based on a true story.

bat out.meaning: To produce something quickly without much care (जल्दी-जल्दी कुछ तैयार करना).
bat out.example: He batted out a rough draft of the article.

bash about.meaning: To treat something roughly or without care (किसी चीज़ को बुरी तरह से संभालना).
bash about.example: The luggage was bashed about during the flight.

batten down.meaning: To prepare for a difficult situation (किसी कठिन परिस्थिति के लिए तैयार होना).
batten down.example: They battened down the hatches before the storm.

bash in.meaning: To hit something very hard, causing damage (किसी चीज़ पर जोर से मारना और उसे क्षतिग्रस्त करना).
bash in.example: The robbers bashed in the door to get inside.

batten on.meaning: To take advantage of someone or something for personal gain (स्वार्थी लाभ के लिए किसी पर निर्भर रहना).
batten on.example: He battened on his wealthy relatives for years.

bash up.meaning: To physically attack and injure someone (किसी को मारपीट कर घायल करना).
bash up.example: He got bashed up in a street fight.

baulk at.meaning: To be unwilling to do something or hesitate (किसी चीज़ को करने में हिचकिचाना).
baulk at.example: She baulked at the idea of spending so much money.

bawl out.meaning: To reprimand someone loudly and severely (किसी को जोर से डांटना).
bawl out.example: The coach bawled out the players for their poor performance.

bear down.meaning: To apply pressure or force to something (किसी चीज़ पर दबाव डालना).
bear down.example: She bore down on the problem until she found a solution.

bear upon.meaning: To be relevant to or have an effect on something (किसी चीज़ से संबंधित होना या उस पर प्रभाव डालना).
bear upon.example: The judge’s decision bears upon the new law.

bear with.meaning: To be patient with someone (किसी के साथ धैर्य रखना).
bear with.example: Please bear with me while I find your details.

beat down.meaning: To try to reduce the price of something (मोलभाव करके कीमत कम करना).
beat down.example: She managed to beat down the price of the car.

bear down on.meaning: To move towards something aggressively or forcefully (किसी चीज़ की ओर तेजी से बढ़ना).
bear down on.example: The storm was bearing down on the coast.

bear on.meaning: To be related to something (किसी चीज़ से जुड़ा होना).
bear on.example: His research bears on the study of climate change.

beat off.meaning: To fight off an attack or competition (हमला या प्रतियोगिता को रोकना).
beat off.example: The goalkeeper beat off several attempts to score.

bear up.meaning: To remain strong in a difficult situation (मुश्किल समय में मजबूती से खड़ा रहना).
bear up.example: She bore up well under the pressure.

beat out.meaning: To defeat someone in a competition (प्रतियोगिता में किसी को हराना).
beat out.example: Our team beat out the rivals in the final round.

beat out of.meaning: To force someone to give up something, often through pressure (किसी से जबरदस्ती कुछ निकलवाना).
beat out of.example: They beat the confession out of him.

beat up.meaning: To attack someone violently (किसी को बुरी तरह से पीटना).
beat up.example: He was beaten up by a gang last night.

bed out.meaning: To plant seedlings outside (बाहरी पौधों को रोपना).
bed out.example: She bedded out the flowers in the garden.

beef up.meaning: To improve or make stronger (किसी चीज़ को और बेहतर या मजबूत बनाना).
beef up.example: They beefed up security after the incident.

beat up on.meaning: To treat someone harshly or unfairly (किसी से कठोरता से पेश आना).
beat up on.example: Stop beating up on yourself over one mistake.

beg off.meaning: To ask to be excused from doing something (किसी चीज़ को करने से बचने के लिए बहाना बनाना).
beg off.example: She begged off attending the late-night party.

beaver away.meaning: To work hard for a long time (किसी काम को लंबे समय तक मेहनत से करना).
beaver away.example: He’s been beavering away at his thesis all week.

begin with.meaning: To start with something (किसी चीज़ से शुरुआत करना).
begin with.example: Let’s begin with a short introduction.

become of.meaning: To happen to someone or something (किसी के साथ क्या हुआ या होगा).
become of.example: What will become of the old house?

believe in.meaning: To have faith or trust in something (किसी चीज़ में विश्वास रखना).
believe in.example: I believe in hard work and determination.

bed down.meaning: To settle down to sleep, usually in an unusual place (अस्थायी रूप से कहीं सो जाना).
bed down.example: The campers bedded down under the stars.

belly out.meaning: To swell outward (फूल जाना, फैल जाना).
belly out.example: The sails bellied out in the strong wind.

belly up to.meaning: To move close to something, especially a bar (किसी चीज़ के पास आना, खासकर बार में).
belly up to.example: He bellied up to the bar and ordered a drink.

belong to.meaning: To be owned by someone (किसी का होना, स्वामित्व में होना).

belt out.meaning: To sing or play music loudly (जोर से गाना या संगीत बजाना).
belt out.example: She belted out her favorite song at the concert.

belt up.meaning: To fasten a seatbelt or to keep quiet (सीटबेल्ट लगाना या चुप रहना).
belt up.example: Belt up before we start driving.

belt into.meaning: To eat or drink something quickly and eagerly (जल्दी से खाना या पीना).
belt into.example: He belted into his lunch after a long day.

bend down.meaning: To lower the upper part of your body (नीचे झुकना).
bend down.example: She bent down to pick up the coin.

bend over.meaning: To lean forward from the waist (कमर से आगे झुकना).
bend over.example: He bent over to tie his shoelaces.

bend over backwards.meaning: To make a great effort to help someone (किसी की मदद के लिए बहुत प्रयास करना).
bend over backwards.example: She bent over backwards to make her guests comfortable.

bind up in.meaning: To be deeply involved in something (किसी चीज़ में गहराई से शामिल होना).
bind up in.example: He was too bound up in his work to notice the time.

bet on.meaning: To wager money or take a risk on something (किसी चीज़ पर दांव लगाना).
bet on.example: I wouldn’t bet on him winning the race.

bite back.meaning: To hold back an angry or sarcastic response (गुस्से को रोकना या दबाना).
bite back.example: She had to bite back a sarcastic remark.

bid on.meaning: To offer a price for something, especially in an auction (नीलामी में कीमत लगाना).
bid on.example: He bid on a rare painting at the auction.

bill as.meaning: To advertise or describe someone or something in a particular way (किसी को किसी रूप में प्रचारित करना).
bill as.example: The film was billed as the best thriller of the year.

bite into.meaning: To sink teeth into something or reduce the effectiveness of something (काटना या प्रभाव कम करना).
bite into.example: Taxes are really biting into my savings.

bind over.meaning: To legally require someone to appear in court (कानूनी रूप से किसी को अदालत में पेश होने के लिए बाध्य करना).
bind over.example: The judge bound him over for trial.

black out.meaning: To lose consciousness or experience a power failure (बेहोश होना या बिजली गुल हो जाना).
black out.example: He blacked out after standing in the sun for too long.

bind to.meaning: To be attached or committed to something (किसी चीज़ से जुड़ा होना या प्रतिबद्ध होना).
bind to.example: He is legally bound to the contract.

blank out.meaning: To forget something suddenly or to cover something to make it unreadable (अचानक भूल जाना या किसी चीज़ को ढंक देना).
blank out.example: I blanked out during the exam and couldn’t remember the answer.

blend in.meaning: To mix or combine well with the surroundings (पर्यावरण में घुल-मिल जाना).
blend in.example: She tried to blend in with the crowd at the party.

blanket with.meaning: To cover something completely (किसी चीज़ को पूरी तरह ढंक देना).
blanket with.example: The field was blanketed with snow.

block off.meaning: To close an area so that people cannot enter (किसी क्षेत्र को बंद कर देना).
block off.example: The police blocked off the road after the accident.

block in.meaning: To prevent someone from moving by parking too close (किसी को बाहर निकलने से रोकना).
block in.example: Someone blocked me in, and I couldn’t drive out.

blast away.meaning: To shoot continuously or make a loud noise (लगातार गोली चलाना या तेज़ आवाज़ करना).
blast away.example: The soldiers blasted away at the enemy base.

block out.meaning: To stop light, noise, or thoughts from entering (प्रकाश, आवाज़, या विचारों को रोकना).
block out.example: I used headphones to block out the noise.

blast off.meaning: To launch into space (अंतरिक्ष में प्रक्षेपण होना).

block up.meaning: To obstruct or fill a space completely (रास्ता बंद कर देना).

blow down.meaning: To fall due to strong wind (तेज़ हवा के कारण गिर जाना).
blow down.example: The storm blew down several trees.

blot out.meaning: To cover or erase something completely (किसी चीज़ को मिटा देना या ढंक देना).

blow in.meaning: To arrive suddenly and unexpectedly (अचानक आ जाना).
blow in.example: She just blew in from New York.

blow off.meaning: To ignore or cancel something casually (किसी को नज़रअंदाज़ करना या टाल देना).
blow off.example: He blew off the meeting to go to the beach.

blow away.meaning: To be extremely impressed or to remove something by wind (अत्यधिक प्रभावित होना या हवा से उड़ जाना).
blow away.example: Her singing really blew me away.

blow out.meaning: To extinguish a flame or cause a tire to burst (आग बुझाना या टायर फट जाना).
blow out.example: He blew out the candles on his birthday cake.

blow over.meaning: To pass without causing harm (किसी समस्या या तूफान का टल जाना).
blow over.example: The scandal will soon blow over.

bluff out.meaning: To deceive someone into believing something (धोखे से विश्वास दिलाना).
bluff out.example: He bluffed out his opponent in the poker game.

blow up.meaning: To explode or become very angry (विस्फोट होना या बहुत गुस्सा हो जाना).
blow up.example: The bomb blew up in the middle of the city.

blunder about.meaning: To move in a clumsy or careless way (असावधानी से घूमना या चलना).
blunder about.example: He blundered about in the dark, knocking things over.

blunder into.meaning: To accidentally encounter something (गलती से किसी चीज़ से टकरा जाना या किसी स्थिति में फंस जाना).
blunder into.example: He blundered into a meeting without realizing it had already started.

bog in.meaning: To start working on something with enthusiasm (जोश के साथ किसी काम में लग जाना).
bog in.example: Everyone bogged in as soon as the food was served.

blurt out.meaning: To say something suddenly without thinking (बिना सोचे समझे अचानक कुछ बोल देना).
blurt out.example: She blurted out the secret before realizing what she had done.

bog off.meaning: To go away (आगे बढ़ जाना, हट जाना) [British slang].
bog off.example: He told them to bog off and leave him alone.

board out.meaning: To arrange for someone to live somewhere else temporarily (किसी को अस्थायी रूप से कहीं और रहने के लिए भेजना).
board out.example: The children were boarded out to a foster family during the war.

boil down.meaning: To reduce the volume or amount of something by boiling (किसी चीज़ को उबालकर कम कर देना).
boil down.example: The sauce needs to boil down before adding the seasoning.

board up.meaning: To cover windows or doors with wooden boards (खिड़कियों या दरवाजों को लकड़ी से ढंक देना).
board up.example: They boarded up the shop before the hurricane hit.

boil down to.meaning: To be the essential or main point (किसी चीज़ का मुख्य सार होना).
boil down to.example: The argument boils down to a simple misunderstanding.

bob up.meaning: To appear suddenly or unexpectedly (अचानक प्रकट हो जाना).
bob up.example: His name keeps bobbing up in our conversations.

boil over.meaning: To spill over due to excessive boiling, or to lose temper (उबलकर बाहर आ जाना या गुस्से में आ जाना).
boil over.example: The milk boiled over while I was on the phone.

bog down.meaning: To become stuck or slowed down (फंस जाना या धीमा हो जाना).
bog down.example: The project bogged down due to financial issues.

book in.meaning: To check in at a hotel or register somewhere (होटल में चेक-इन करना या कहीं पंजीकरण कराना).
book in.example: We booked in at the hotel for two nights.

boil up.meaning: To heat a liquid until it boils or to feel strong emotions (किसी चीज़ को उबालना या भावनाओं का प्रबल हो जाना).
boil up.example: Anger boiled up inside him when he heard the news.

bolt down.meaning: To eat food very quickly (जल्दी-जल्दी खाना खाना).
bolt down.example: He bolted down his breakfast before rushing to work.

book up.meaning: To reserve all available places (सभी जगहें बुक कर लेना).
book up.example: The tickets were booked up weeks in advance.

bomb out.meaning: To fail badly or be forced to leave due to bombing (बुरी तरह असफल होना या बमबारी के कारण भाग जाना).
bomb out.example: The play bombed out after just one week.

boom out.meaning: To make a very loud noise (तेज़ आवाज़ में बोलना या गूंजना).
boom out.example: The announcer’s voice boomed out across the stadium.

bombard with.meaning: To attack someone with a lot of questions, messages, or criticism (किसी को बहुत सारे प्रश्न, संदेश या आलोचना से भर देना).
bombard with.example: The customer service team was bombarded with complaints after the product launch.

boomerang on.meaning: To have the opposite effect of what was intended (किसी योजना या क्रिया का उल्टा प्रभाव पड़ना).
boomerang on.example: His plan to frame his rival boomeranged on him when the truth came out.

bone up.meaning: To study intensively before an exam or important event (किसी विषय को जल्दी और गहराई से पढ़ना).
bone up.example: She boned up on math before the big test.

boot out.meaning: To force someone to leave (किसी को जबरदस्ती बाहर निकाल देना).
boot out.example: The unruly guest was booted out of the restaurant.

boot up.meaning: To start a computer or operating system (कंप्यूटर को चालू करना).
boot up.example: He booted up his laptop to check emails.

botch up.meaning: To mess up or ruin something (किसी काम को खराब या गलत कर देना).
botch up.example: He botched up the project by missing important details.

border on.meaning: To be very close to something (किसी चीज़ के बहुत करीब होना).
border on.example: His rude behavior bordered on disrespect.

bottle out.meaning: To lose courage and decide not to do something (डर की वजह से कुछ न करना).
bottle out.example: He wanted to confront his boss but bottled out at the last moment.

bottle up.meaning: To suppress emotions and not express them (भावनाओं को दबाकर रखना).
bottle up.example: She bottled up her anger instead of confronting the issue.

bore into.meaning: To stare at someone intensely or to drill into something (किसी को ध्यान से देखना या किसी चीज़ में छेद करना).
bore into.example: His eyes bored into mine as he waited for an answer.

boss about.meaning: To give orders in an annoying way (बेवजह आदेश देना).
boss about.example: She keeps bossing her younger brother about.

bottom out.meaning: To reach the lowest point before starting to rise again (किसी स्थिति का सबसे निचला स्तर पर पहुंच जाना).
bottom out.example: The economy finally bottomed out after months of decline.

bounce around.meaning: To discuss ideas with different people (विचारों का आदान-प्रदान करना).
bounce around.example: We bounced around some ideas for the new project.

bounce back.meaning: To recover quickly from a setback (मुश्किलों से जल्दी उबर जाना).
bounce back.example: After losing the match, he bounced back with a strong performance.

box in.meaning: To restrict someone’s movement or options (किसी को सीमित कर देना).
box in.example: The parked cars boxed me in, and I couldn't leave.

bounce into.meaning: To persuade someone to do something (किसी को किसी काम के लिए मजबूर कर देना).
bounce into.example: She bounced him into accepting the job.

bounce off.meaning: To test an idea by discussing it with someone (किसी विचार पर प्रतिक्रिया लेना).
bounce off.example: Let me bounce this idea off you before I finalize the plan.

box up.meaning: To put things into boxes (चीजों को डिब्बों में रखना).
box up.example: They boxed up all their belongings before moving.

bow down.meaning: To show deep respect or surrender (गहरा सम्मान दिखाना या आत्मसमर्पण करना).
bow down.example: He bowed down before the king.

brace up.meaning: To prepare oneself mentally or physically for something difficult (किसी कठिन परिस्थिति के लिए तैयार होना).
brace up.example: He braced up before delivering his speech.

bow out.meaning: To withdraw from a situation or competition (किसी चीज़ से पीछे हटना या संन्यास लेना).
bow out.example: She bowed out of the competition due to an injury.

branch out.meaning: To expand into new areas of business or activities (नई चीज़ों में हाथ आज़माना).
branch out.example: The company is branching out into the tech industry.

break down.meaning: To stop working or to become emotionally upset (बंद हो जाना या भावनात्मक रूप से टूट जाना).
break down.example: The car broke down on the way to work.

brave out.meaning: To face a difficult situation with courage (साहस के साथ कठिनाई का सामना करना).
brave out.example: She braved out the storm without showing any fear.

brazen out.meaning: To act confidently in a difficult situation (कठिन परिस्थिति में आत्मविश्वास से काम लेना).
brazen out.example: He brazened out the accusations without any sign of guilt.

break away.meaning: To escape from something or someone (किसी से दूर भाग जाना या अलग हो जाना).
break away.example: The prisoner broke away from the guards.

break for.meaning: To suddenly move towards something (किसी चीज़ की ओर अचानक बढ़ना).
break for.example: He broke for the exit when the fire alarm rang.

break in on.meaning: To interrupt a conversation or event (बातचीत या घटना में दखल देना).
break in on.example: She broke in on their meeting with an urgent message.

break in.meaning: To forcefully enter a place or to train something new (जबरदस्ती घुसना या कुछ नया इस्तेमाल करने के लिए तैयार करना).
break in.example: Thieves broke in last night and stole valuable items.

break into.meaning: To enter a place by force (बलपूर्वक किसी जगह में घुसना).
break into.example: The burglars broke into the house through the back door.

break off.meaning: To end something suddenly, like a relationship or discussion (अचानक रिश्ता या बातचीत खत्म करना).
break off.example: They broke off their engagement due to personal differences.

break out.meaning: To escape or suddenly start (अचानक शुरू होना या भाग जाना).
break out.example: A fire broke out in the warehouse last night.

break off with.meaning: To end a relationship with someone (किसी के साथ रिश्ता तोड़ना).
break off with.example: She broke off with her business partner after a dispute.

break out in.meaning: To develop a skin reaction like rash or sweat (त्वचा पर दाने निकलना या पसीना आना).
break out in.example: He broke out in a rash after eating peanuts.

break through.meaning: To overcome an obstacle or difficulty (बाधा को पार करना).
break through.example: The researchers finally broke through the problem and found a cure.

break up.meaning: To end a relationship, meeting, or school term (रिश्ता, बैठक, या स्कूल सत्र समाप्त करना).
break up.example: They broke up after five years of dating.

breeze in.meaning: To enter a place quickly and confidently (तेजी और आत्मविश्वास से प्रवेश करना).
breeze in.example: She breezed in like she owned the place.

breeze into.meaning: To enter a place casually or effortlessly (बिना किसी प्रयास के कहीं प्रवेश करना).
breeze into.example: He breezed into the meeting without a care in the world.

break with.meaning: To end a connection or tradition (किसी परंपरा या व्यक्ति से नाता तोड़ना).
break with.example: She decided to break with tradition and start her own business.

breeze through.meaning: To do something easily and with little effort (आसानी से कोई काम कर लेना).
breeze through.example: She breezed through the exam without any difficulty.

breathe in.meaning: To inhale air or a substance (सांस अंदर लेना).
breathe in.example: She closed her eyes and breathed in the fresh mountain air.

breathe out.example: He took a deep breath and breathed out slowly.

brick in.meaning: To block an opening with bricks (ईंटों से कोई रास्ता बंद करना).
brick in.example: They bricked in the old doorway during renovations.

brighten up.meaning: To make something more cheerful or to improve the weather (खुशहाल बनाना या मौसम साफ़ होना).
brighten up.example: Her smile brightened up the whole room.

bring along.meaning: To take someone or something with you (अपने साथ लाना).
bring along.example: She brought along her best friend to the party.

brim over.meaning: To overflow with emotion or liquid (भावनाओं या तरल से भर जाना).
brim over.example: Her heart brimmed over with happiness at the good news.

brim over with.meaning: To be full of a particular quality (किसी भावना से पूरी तरह भरा होना).
brim over with.example: He was brimming over with confidence before the presentation.

bring around.meaning: To persuade someone or to revive someone (किसी को मनाना या बेहोशी से होश में लाना).
bring around.example: It took time, but she finally brought him around to her way of thinking.

brim with.meaning: To be full of something (किसी चीज़ से पूरी तरह भरा होना).
brim with.example: Her eyes brimmed with tears of joy.

bring about.meaning: To cause something to happen (किसी चीज़ को संभव बनाना या कारण बनना).
bring about.example: The new policy brought about significant changes in the system.

bring back.meaning: To return something or to make someone remember something (वापस लाना या किसी को याद दिलाना).
bring back.example: This song brings back so many childhood memories.

bring down.meaning: To reduce something or to cause someone to lose power (किसी चीज़ को कम करना या किसी को सत्ता से हटाना).
bring down.example: The government is trying to bring down inflation.

bring back to.meaning: To restore someone’s consciousness or recall something to memory (किसी को होश में लाना या याद दिलाना).
bring back to.example: The smell of fresh bread brought back to my childhood memories.

bring forth.meaning: To produce or present something (किसी चीज़ को प्रस्तुत करना या उत्पन्न करना).
bring forth.example: The discussion brought forth many new ideas.

bring before.meaning: To present someone or something for consideration or judgment (किसी को अदालत या अधिकारियों के सामने प्रस्तुत करना).
bring before.example: The case was brought before the judge for a final decision.

bring forward.meaning: To present an idea or proposal or to move an event to an earlier date (किसी विचार को प्रस्तुत करना या किसी कार्यक्रम को पहले कर देना).
bring forward.example: They decided to bring forward the meeting to Monday.

bring in.meaning: To introduce something new or earn money (किसी नए नियम को लागू करना या आय अर्जित करना).
bring in.example: The new law was brought in to control pollution.

bring on.meaning: To cause something to happen, usually something bad (किसी नकारात्मक चीज़ का कारण बनना).
bring on.example: The cold weather brought on his fever again.

bring out.meaning: To make something visible or publish something (किसी चीज़ को उजागर करना या प्रकाशित करना).
bring out.example: This makeup brings out the beauty of your eyes.

bring into.meaning: To involve someone in a situation or discussion (किसी को किसी स्थिति या चर्चा में शामिल करना).
bring into.example: They brought him into the team to strengthen the defense.

bring off.meaning: To successfully complete something difficult (किसी कठिन चीज़ को सफलतापूर्वक पूरा करना).
bring off.example: She brought off the business deal despite all the challenges.

bring out in.meaning: To cause a skin reaction or emotional response (त्वचा की प्रतिक्रिया या भावनात्मक प्रतिक्रिया उत्पन्न करना).
bring out in.example: The heat brings me out in a rash.

bring over to.meaning: To convince someone to change their opinion or bring someone to a place (किसी को मनाना या किसी को किसी जगह लाना).
bring over to.example: He brought me over to his point of view after a long discussion.

bring to.meaning: To restore consciousness or awareness (होश में लाना या जागरूक करना).
bring to.example: The cold water helped bring him to after he fainted.

bring together.meaning: To unite people or things (लोगों या चीजों को एक साथ लाना).
bring together.example: The event brought together experts from various fields.

brush aside.meaning: To ignore or dismiss something (किसी चीज़ को नज़रअंदाज करना या खारिज करना).
brush aside.example: He brushed aside my concerns about the project.

brush by.meaning: To move past someone quickly, often touching them slightly (किसी के पास से तेजी से गुजरना).
brush by.example: She brushed by me without saying a word.

brush down.meaning: To clean or tidy something by brushing (ब्रश करके साफ करना).
brush down.example: He brushed down his jacket before entering the meeting.

bring upon.meaning: To cause something unpleasant to happen to someone (किसी पर मुसीबत लाना).
bring upon.example: His careless actions brought disaster upon the company.

brush off.meaning: To ignore or reject something casually (किसी को हल्के में टालना या अनदेखा करना).
brush off.example: She brushed off his rude comments and continued her work.

broaden out.meaning: To expand or widen something (किसी चीज़ को विस्तृत करना).
broaden out.example: His interests broadened out after traveling to different countries.

brush up.meaning: To improve or refresh knowledge or a skill (अपने कौशल को सुधारना या ताज़ा करना).
brush up.example: She brushed up on her Spanish before going to Spain.

bristle with.meaning: To be full of or covered with something (किसी चीज़ से भरा या ढका होना).
bristle with.example: The speech bristled with anger and frustration.

bubble over.meaning: To be full of excitement or enthusiasm (उत्साह या जोश से भरा होना).
bubble over.example: She was bubbling over with joy after getting the job.

bugger about.meaning: To waste time doing unimportant things (बेवजह समय बर्बाद करना).
bugger about.example: Stop buggering about and get to work!

bucket down.meaning: To rain very heavily (तेज़ बारिश होना).
bucket down.example: It was bucketing down all night, so the roads were flooded.

buckle down.meaning: To start working seriously (कड़ी मेहनत शुरू करना).
buckle down.example: If you want to pass the exam, you need to buckle down.

bugger off.meaning: To go away or leave, often rudely (दूर चले जाना, आमतौर पर असभ्य तरीके से).
bugger off.example: He told them to bugger off when they kept bothering him.

buckle up.meaning: To fasten your seatbelt (सीट बेल्ट लगाना).
buckle up.example: The driver told everyone to buckle up before starting the car.

buddy up to.meaning: To try to become friendly with someone, often for personal gain (स्वार्थ के लिए किसी से दोस्ती करना).
buddy up to.example: He tried to buddy up to the manager for a promotion.

bugger up.meaning: To ruin or spoil something (किसी चीज़ को खराब करना).
bugger up.example: I buggered up my computer by downloading a virus.

budge up.meaning: To move slightly to make space for someone (थोड़ा खिसकना ताकि किसी को जगह मिले).
budge up.example: Can you budge up a little? I need some space to sit.

build around.meaning: To base something on a particular idea or concept (किसी विचार के आधार पर कुछ विकसित करना).
build around.example: The project was built around the idea of sustainability.

bug off.meaning: To go away or leave, often rudely (दूर चले जाना, आमतौर पर असभ्य तरीके से).
bug off.example: He told his little brother to bug off when he kept asking questions.

build in.meaning: To include something as a permanent part (किसी चीज़ को स्थायी रूप से शामिल करना).
build in.example: The architect built in extra storage spaces in the design.

bug out.meaning: To leave quickly, especially due to fear (डर की वजह से जल्दी से निकल जाना).
bug out.example: When they heard the alarm, they bugged out immediately.

build on.meaning: To use something as a foundation for further development (आधार बनाकर कुछ और विकसित करना).
build on.example: She built on her previous knowledge to improve her research.

build up to.meaning: To gradually prepare for a big event (धीरे-धीरे किसी बड़े काम के लिए तैयारी करना).
build up to.example: The excitement built up to the final match.

build up.meaning: To increase or strengthen something (कुछ बढ़ाना या मजबूत करना).
build up.example: She built up her confidence by practicing public speaking.

bulk out.meaning: To make something bigger or thicker (किसी चीज़ को बड़ा या मोटा बनाना).
bulk out.example: He bulked out his essay with extra details.

bulk up.meaning: To gain muscle or increase in size (शरीर का आकार या मांसपेशियां बढ़ाना).
bulk up.example: He is bulking up by lifting weights daily.

bum about.meaning: To spend time lazily without a goal (बिना उद्देश्य के आलस्य में समय बिताना).
bum about.example: He spent the summer bumming about the beach.

bum off.meaning: To borrow or take something without returning (किसी से कुछ उधार लेना और वापस न करना).
bum off.example: He always bums off cigarettes from his friends.

bum out.meaning: To make someone sad or disappointed (किसी को उदास या निराश करना).
bum out.example: The bad news really bummed him out.

bundle up.meaning: To dress warmly in many layers (गर्म कपड़े पहनना).
bundle up.example: She bundled up before going out in the snow.

bump along.meaning: To progress with difficulty (मुश्किल से आगे बढ़ना).
bump along.example: The project bumped along despite many challenges.

bump into.meaning: To meet someone unexpectedly (अचानक किसी से टकरा जाना या मिलना).
bump into.example: I bumped into my old teacher at the mall.

bung up.meaning: To block or damage something (किसी चीज़ को अवरुद्ध या क्षतिग्रस्त करना).
bung up.example: She bunged up her knee while playing football.

bump off.meaning: To kill someone (किसी को मार डालना).
bump off.example: The gangster planned to bump off his rival.

bump up.example: The company bumped up the prices of their products.

bunk down.meaning: To sleep somewhere temporarily (किसी जगह अस्थायी रूप से सोना).
bunk down.example: They bunked down in the living room for the night.

bunk off.meaning: To skip school or work without permission (बिना अनुमति के स्कूल या काम से गायब रहना).
bunk off.example: He bunked off school to go to the beach.

bunch up.meaning: To gather together in a tight group (किसी समूह को कसकर इकट्ठा करना).
bunch up.example: The students bunched up near the entrance.

buoy up.meaning: To support or uplift someone's spirits (किसी का उत्साह बढ़ाना).
buoy up.example: His friends buoyed him up during his tough times.

bundle off.meaning: To send someone away quickly (किसी को जल्दी भेज देना).
bundle off.example: They bundled off the kids to bed early.

burn down.meaning: To destroy something by fire completely (आग से पूरी तरह नष्ट कर देना).
burn down.example: The old building burned down last night.

burn off.meaning: To remove something by heat or exercise (गर्मी या व्यायाम से किसी चीज़ को हटाना).
burn off.example: He burned off extra calories by running.

burn up.meaning: To feel extremely hot or cause something to burn (बहुत गर्म महसूस करना या जलाना).
burn up.example: He was burning up with fever.

burn out.meaning: To become exhausted from overwork (अत्यधिक काम से थक जाना).
burn out.example: She burned out after working 16-hour shifts.

burst in.meaning: To enter a place suddenly and forcefully (अचानक और ज़ोर से किसी जगह में प्रवेश करना).

burst into.meaning: To suddenly begin doing something (अचानक किसी चीज़ की शुरुआत करना).
burst into.example: She burst into tears after hearing the news.

burst out.meaning: To suddenly start doing something (अचानक कुछ करना).
burst out.example: She burst out laughing when she heard the joke.

bust up.meaning: To break or end something, often a relationship (किसी चीज़ को तोड़ना या समाप्त करना).
bust up.example: They busted up after years of marriage.

burst with.meaning: To be full of a strong feeling (किसी भावना से भर जाना).
burst with.example: She was bursting with excitement before the trip.

bury away.meaning: To hide something securely (किसी चीज़ को सुरक्षित रूप से छिपाना).
bury away.example: He buried away his childhood toys in the attic.

bury in.meaning: To immerse oneself deeply in something (किसी चीज़ में पूरी तरह डूब जाना).
bury in.example: She buried herself in her studies before exams.

bust out.meaning: To escape from a place or start something suddenly (किसी जगह से भाग जाना या अचानक शुरू करना).
bust out.example: The prisoners busted out of jail last night.

bustle about.meaning: To move around quickly and busily (जल्दी और व्यस्तता से इधर-उधर घूमना).
bustle about.example: She bustled about the kitchen, preparing dinner.

butt in.meaning: To interrupt someone rudely (बिना अनुमति के बातचीत में दखल देना).
butt in.example: He always butts in when people are talking.

buy in.meaning: To agree with or support an idea (किसी विचार से सहमत होना).
buy in.example: She bought into the company’s vision for the future.

buy into.meaning: To invest in something, especially a business (किसी व्यवसाय में निवेश करना).
buy into.example: He bought into a new startup last year.

butt out.meaning: To stop interfering in someone’s business (किसी के मामले में दखल देना बंद करना).
butt out.example: This is not your concern, so butt out!

buy off.meaning: To bribe someone to gain favor (किसी को रिश्वत देकर मनाना).
buy off.example: The politician was accused of buying off the officials.

buy out.meaning: To purchase all of something or someone's share (किसी का पूरा हिस्सा खरीद लेना).
buy out.example: He bought out his business partner last year.

button down.meaning: To secure or finalize something (किसी चीज़ को निश्चित या सुरक्षित करना).
button down.example: We need to button down the project details before launch.

butter up.meaning: To flatter someone to gain favor (किसी को खुश करने के लिए चापलूसी करना).
butter up.example: He buttered up his boss to get a promotion.

buy out of.meaning: To pay to get out of an obligation (किसी अनुबंध से बाहर निकलने के लिए भुगतान करना).
buy out of.example: He bought out of his contract with the company.

button up.meaning: To fasten buttons on clothing or to finish something carefully (कपड़ों के बटन लगाना या किसी काम को सावधानीपूर्वक समाप्त करना).
button up.example: He buttoned up his coat before stepping out.

buy up.meaning: To purchase all or most of something (किसी चीज़ को पूरी तरह से खरीद लेना).
buy up.example: A wealthy investor bought up all the land in the area.

buzz off.meaning: To go away quickly (जल्दी से चले जाना).
buzz off.example: He told me to buzz off when I asked too many questions.

buzz about.meaning: To move around quickly and busily (तेजी से इधर-उधर घूमना).
buzz about.example: The workers were buzzing about, preparing for the event.

call around.meaning: To contact multiple people or places to get information (किसी जानकारी के लिए कई लोगों या जगहों से संपर्क करना).
call around.example: She called around to find a good mechanic.

call by.meaning: To briefly visit someone’s place (किसी के घर या स्थान पर थोड़े समय के लिए जाना).
call by.example: I will call by your house on my way home.

call away.meaning: To ask someone to leave their current activity for something else (किसी को किसी अन्य कार्य के लिए बुलाना).
call away.example: He was called away for an emergency meeting.

call back.meaning: To return a phone call (किसी को दोबारा फोन करना).
call back.example: I missed his call, so I need to call him back.

call for.meaning: To demand or require something (किसी चीज़ की मांग करना या आवश्यकता होना).
call for.example: The situation calls for immediate action.

call down.meaning: To reprimand or scold someone (किसी को डांटना या फटकार लगाना).
call down.example: The manager called him down for being late.

call forth.meaning: To bring something into existence or action (किसी चीज़ को बुलाना या प्रेरित करना).
call forth.example: The speech called forth strong emotions among the audience.

call in.meaning: To request someone’s presence or service (किसी को बुलाना या सहायता मांगना).
call in.example: We had to call in a specialist to fix the issue.

call on.meaning: To visit someone formally (औपचारिक रूप से किसी से मिलना).
call on.example: I called on my professor for advice.

call upon.meaning: To officially ask someone to do something (औपचारिक रूप से किसी से कुछ करने को कहना).
call upon.example: The leader called upon the citizens to stay united.

call out.meaning: To shout or announce something loudly (जोर से पुकारना या घोषणा करना).
call out.example: She called out his name in the crowd.

call off.meaning: To cancel an event or plan (किसी योजना या कार्यक्रम को रद्द करना).
call off.example: The match was called off due to rain.

call out for.meaning: To ask loudly for help or assistance (मदद के लिए जोर से पुकारना).
call out for.example: The injured man called out for help.

call over.meaning: To invite someone to come closer (किसी को पास बुलाना).
call over.example: He called me over to show something interesting.

call round.meaning: To visit someone briefly (किसी से थोड़े समय के लिए मिलने जाना).
call round.example: I’ll call round later to see how you're doing.

call up.meaning: To phone someone or summon for duty (किसी को फोन करना या सेवा के लिए बुलाना).
call up.example: She called up her friend to chat.

calm down.meaning: To become less angry or excited (गुस्सा या उत्तेजना कम करना).
calm down.example: He took a deep breath to calm down.

camp out.meaning: To sleep outdoors, usually in a tent (खुले में या टेंट में रात बिताना).
camp out.example: They decided to camp out by the lake.

camp up.meaning: To exaggerate behavior or style in a theatrical way (अत्यधिक नाटकीय रूप से व्यवहार करना).
camp up.example: He camped up his role to make the audience laugh.

cancel out.meaning: To neutralize or counteract an effect (किसी प्रभाव को बेअसर करना).
cancel out.example: The gains were canceled out by unexpected losses.

capitalize on.meaning: To take advantage of a situation or opportunity (किसी अवसर का लाभ उठाना).
capitalize on.example: He capitalized on his opponent's mistake to win the game.

carry off.meaning: To succeed in doing something difficult (किसी कठिन कार्य को सफलतापूर्वक पूरा करना).
carry off.example: She carried off the performance despite her nervousness.

care for.meaning: To look after or take care of someone or something (किसी की देखभाल करना).
care for.example: She cares for her elderly parents at home.

carry on.meaning: To continue doing something (किसी कार्य को जारी रखना).
carry on.example: Despite the rain, they carried on with the match.

carry away.meaning: To become overly excited or emotional (भावनाओं में बह जाना).
carry away.example: He got carried away while telling the story.

carry forward.meaning: To continue or progress with something (किसी कार्य को आगे बढ़ाना).
carry forward.example: They carried forward the research started by their predecessors.

carry out.meaning: To perform or execute a task or plan (किसी कार्य या योजना को अंजाम देना).
carry out.example: The scientist carried out several experiments.

cart off.meaning: To remove or take someone/something away, often forcibly (किसी को जबरन हटाना या ले जाना).
cart off.example: The police carted off the protesters from the street.

carry over.meaning: To extend something into another time or place (किसी चीज़ को अगले समय तक जारी रखना).
carry over.example: The discussion was carried over to the next meeting.

carve out.meaning: To create or establish something through effort (कड़ी मेहनत से कुछ बनाना या हासिल करना).
carve out.example: She carved out a successful career in journalism.

carve up.meaning: To divide something into smaller parts (किसी चीज़ को टुकड़ों में बांटना).
carve up.example: The land was carved up among the heirs.

cash in.meaning: To exchange something for money (किसी चीज़ को पैसे में बदलना).
cash in.example: He cashed in his savings bonds to buy a car.

carry through.meaning: To complete something successfully despite difficulties (कठिनाइयों के बावजूद किसी चीज़ को पूरा करना).
carry through.example: Her determination carried her through the tough times.

cash in on.meaning: To take advantage of a situation for profit (किसी अवसर का लाभ उठाकर पैसा कमाना).
cash in on.example: They cashed in on the trend by launching a new product.

cash up.meaning: To count and check the total money received (दिन के अंत में पैसे की गणना करना).
cash up.example: The cashier cashed up before closing the store.

cast off.meaning: To get rid of or remove something (किसी चीज़ से छुटकारा पाना).
cast off.example: He cast off his old habits and adopted a healthier lifestyle.

cast about.meaning: To search around for something (किसी चीज़ को खोजने की कोशिश करना).
cast about.example: He cast about for a new job after quitting his old one.

cast aside.meaning: To discard or reject something (किसी चीज़ को छोड़ देना या अस्वीकार करना).
cast aside.example: She cast aside her doubts and took the opportunity.

cast down.meaning: To make someone feel sad or depressed (किसी को दुखी या निराश करना).
cast down.example: The failure of his project cast him down.

cast up.meaning: To throw or bring something up, especially to the surface (कुछ सतह पर लाना या उछालना).
cast up.example: The storm cast up debris onto the shore.

cast on.meaning: To start knitting by making the first row of stitches (बुनाई की शुरुआत करना).
cast on.example: She cast on 30 stitches to begin the sweater.

cast away.meaning: To throw something away or discard it (किसी चीज़ को फेंक देना या त्याग देना).
cast away.example: He cast away his old clothes after cleaning his wardrobe.

cast out.meaning: To expel or drive someone/something away (किसी को निकाल देना या बाहर करना).
cast out.example: The villagers cast out the troublemaker from their community.

catch at.meaning: To try to grasp or seize something quickly (जल्दी से किसी चीज़ को पकड़ने की कोशिश करना).
catch at.example: She caught at his arm to stop him from falling.

catch on.meaning: To become popular or understood (लोकप्रिय या समझ में आना).
catch on.example: The new fashion trend quickly caught on among teenagers.

catch up in.meaning: To become involved in something unintentionally (अनजाने में किसी चीज़ में शामिल हो जाना).
catch up in.example: He got caught up in the excitement of the game.

catch out.meaning: To trick or surprise someone by exposing their mistake (गलती पकड़कर किसी को चौंका देना).
catch out.example: The reporter caught the politician out with a tough question.

catch up on.meaning: To do something that was missed or delayed (छूटे हुए कार्य को पूरा करना).
catch up on.example: I need to catch up on my reading this weekend.

catch up with.meaning: To reach someone or something after lagging behind (किसी को पकड़ लेना या बराबरी कर लेना).
catch up with.example: She ran fast to catch up with her friend.

catch up.meaning: To reach the same level as others (एक ही स्तर तक पहुँच जाना).
catch up.example: He studied hard to catch up with the rest of the class.

cater for.meaning: To provide what is needed or required (आवश्यकता पूरी करना).
cater for.example: The restaurant caters for both vegetarians and non-vegetarians.

cater to.meaning: To provide or satisfy the needs and desires of a specific group (किसी विशेष समूह की आवश्यकताओं को पूरा करना).
cater to.example: The hotel caters to business travelers with its conference facilities.

cave in.meaning: To collapse or give way under pressure (दबाव में गिर जाना या झुक जाना).
cave in.example: The roof caved in due to the heavy snowfall.

chain up.meaning: To restrain or secure something using a chain (किसी को जंजीर से बाँधना या सुरक्षित करना).
chain up.example: They chained up their bicycles outside the store.

chalk up.meaning: To achieve or record something as a success or failure (किसी उपलब्धि या असफलता को दर्ज करना).
chalk up.example: The team chalked up another victory in the tournament.

chalk up to.meaning: To attribute something to a particular cause (किसी चीज़ का कारण मानना).
chalk up to.example: He chalked his bad mood up to lack of sleep.

center around.meaning: To focus or revolve around a particular topic or subject (किसी विशेष विषय के इर्द-गिर्द केंद्रित होना).
center around.example: The discussion centered around climate change.

chance on.meaning: To find or meet something or someone unexpectedly (अचानक से किसी चीज़ या व्यक्ति को ढूँढ़ लेना).
chance on.example: She chanced on an old diary while cleaning her room.

chance upon.meaning: To come across something or someone unexpectedly (अचानक किसी से मिलना या कुछ पाना).
chance upon.example: He chanced upon a rare book in the antique shop.

change around.meaning: To rearrange or alter the order of things (वस्तुओं की व्यवस्था बदलना).
change around.example: She changed the furniture around to give the room a new look.

center on.meaning: To focus primarily on something (मुख्य रूप से किसी चीज़ पर ध्यान केंद्रित करना).
center on.example: The movie centers on a young scientist's discoveries.

change down.meaning: To shift to a lower gear in a vehicle (गाड़ी की गति कम करने के लिए गियर बदलना).
change down.example: He changed down to second gear while driving uphill.

charge up.meaning: To recharge a battery or to energize someone (बैटरी चार्ज करना या किसी को उत्साहित करना).
charge up.example: I need to charge up my phone before we leave.

change into.meaning: To transform or switch from one state to another (किसी चीज़ में बदल जाना या कपड़े बदलना).
change into.example: She changed into her sportswear before going to the gym.

chase down.meaning: To pursue and catch someone or something (पीछा करके पकड़ना).
chase down.example: The detective chased down the suspect after a long pursuit.

change over.meaning: To switch from one system or method to another (एक प्रणाली से दूसरी प्रणाली में बदलना).
change over.example: The company is changing over to a new software system.

chase off.meaning: To force someone or something to leave (किसी को भगा देना).
chase off.example: The dog chased off the intruder in the yard.

chase up.meaning: To follow up on something to ensure progress (किसी चीज़ की प्रगति की जानकारी लेना).
chase up.example: I'll chase up the supplier about our delayed order.

change round.meaning: To rearrange things in a different order (चीजों को एक नए क्रम में व्यवस्थित करना).
change round.example: She changed the furniture round to give the room a fresh look.

change up.meaning: To increase the level, intensity, or speed of something (किसी चीज़ की तीव्रता या गति बढ़ाना).
change up.example: He changed up his training routine to improve his stamina.

chat up.meaning: To talk to someone in a flirtatious way (किसी से आकर्षित करने के लिए बातचीत करना).
chat up.example: He tried to chat up the girl at the party.

check in.meaning: To register at a hotel, airport, or event (होटल, हवाई अड्डे या कार्यक्रम में पंजीकरण कराना).
check in.example: We checked in at the hotel around noon.

cheat on.meaning: To be unfaithful in a relationship (रिश्ते में धोखा देना).
cheat on.example: She found out that he was cheating on her.

check into.meaning: To investigate or examine something (किसी चीज़ की जांच करना या होटल में प्रवेश करना).
check into.example: The police are checking into the matter.

check off.meaning: To mark items on a list as completed (सूची में से चीजों को पूरा होने पर चिह्नित करना).
check off.example: He checked off all the tasks on his to-do list.

check out.meaning: To leave a hotel after a stay or to examine something (होटल से चेक आउट करना या किसी चीज़ की जांच करना).
check out.example: We checked out of the hotel early in the morning.

cheer on.meaning: To encourage someone with cheers and support (किसी को उत्साहित करना और समर्थन देना).
cheer on.example: The crowd cheered on the marathon runners.

cheer up.meaning: To make someone feel happier (किसी को खुश करना).
cheer up.example: She brought him a gift to cheer him up.

chew on.meaning: To think about something carefully (किसी चीज़ पर ध्यान से विचार करना).
chew on.example: I'll need some time to chew on this idea before making a decision.

check over.meaning: To examine something carefully for errors or issues (किसी चीज़ की सावधानीपूर्वक जांच करना).
check over.example: He checked over the car before buying it.

chew out.meaning: To scold someone severely (किसी को कड़ी फटकार लगाना).
chew out.example: The coach chewed out the players for their poor performance.

check up.meaning: To examine or verify something (किसी चीज़ की जांच करना या पुष्टि करना).
check up.example: I need to check up on the project’s progress.

check up on.meaning: To investigate or monitor someone or something (किसी की निगरानी करना या उसकी प्रगति की जांच करना).
check up on.example: She checks up on her elderly parents every weekend.

chew up.meaning: To damage something by biting or tearing (किसी चीज़ को चबा कर नष्ट करना).
chew up.example: The dog chewed up my homework.

chew over.meaning: To think carefully about something (किसी चीज़ पर गहराई से विचार करना).
chew over.example: Let me chew over your suggestion before making a decision.

chip in.meaning: To contribute money or effort to something (किसी कार्य में योगदान देना).
chip in.example: Everyone chipped in to buy a gift for the teacher.

chicken out.meaning: To decide not to do something out of fear (डर के कारण कुछ न करना).
chicken out.example: He chickened out of the bungee jump at the last minute.

chill out.meaning: To relax and calm down (आराम करना और शांत रहना).
chill out.example: You need to chill out and stop worrying so much.

chime in.meaning: To interrupt or add a comment in a conversation (बातचीत में बीच में बोलना).
chime in.example: She chimed in with her opinion during the discussion.

chivvy along.meaning: To urge someone to move or act faster (किसी को तेजी से आगे बढ़ने के लिए प्रेरित करना).
chivvy along.example: The teacher chivvied the students along to finish their work.

choke back.meaning: To suppress or hold back emotions (भावनाओं को दबाना).
choke back.example: She choked back her tears during the farewell speech.

chime in with.meaning: To agree or be in harmony with something (किसी चीज़ से सहमत होना या मेल खाना).
chime in with.example: His ideas chime in with the company’s vision.

choke down.meaning: To force oneself to swallow something difficult (मुश्किल से निगलना).
choke down.example: He choked down the bitter medicine.

chip away at.meaning: To gradually weaken or erode something (धीरे-धीरे किसी चीज़ को कमजोर करना).
chip away at.example: Constant criticism chipped away at his confidence.

choke off.meaning: To stop or cut off something forcefully (किसी चीज़ को जबरदस्ती रोकना).
choke off.example: The government choked off the illegal trade.

choke up.meaning: To become emotional and unable to speak (भावुक होकर बोलने में असमर्थ होना).
choke up.example: He choked up while giving his farewell speech.

chuck away.meaning: To throw something away or waste an opportunity (किसी चीज़ को फेंक देना या अवसर गंवा देना).
chuck away.example: Don't chuck away your old books; donate them instead.

chuck in.meaning: To quit or give up something (किसी चीज़ को छोड़ देना).
chuck in.example: He decided to chuck in his job and travel the world.

chuck up.meaning: To vomit or abandon something (उल्टी करना या किसी चीज़ को छोड़ देना).
chuck up.example: He drank too much and ended up chucking up.

choose up.meaning: To form teams by choosing members (टीम बनाने के लिए सदस्यों को चुनना).
choose up.example: We chose up sides before starting the football match.

chuck out.meaning: To force someone to leave (किसी को बाहर निकालना).
chuck out.example: The landlord chucked out the noisy tenants.

chop down.meaning: To cut down a tree or something tall (किसी पेड़ या ऊँची चीज़ को काट देना).
chop down.example: They chopped down the old oak tree in the backyard.

chop up.meaning: To cut something into small pieces (किसी चीज़ को छोटे टुकड़ों में काटना).
chop up.example: She chopped up the vegetables for the soup.

chow down.meaning: To eat enthusiastically (जोश के साथ खाना).
chow down.example: We chowed down on burgers and fries at the party.

chum up.meaning: To become friendly with someone (किसी से दोस्ती करना).
chum up.example: He quickly chummed up with his new classmates.

churn out.meaning: To produce something in large quantities, often quickly and carelessly (तेजी से बड़ी मात्रा में उत्पादन करना).
churn out.example: The factory churns out thousands of toys every day.

churn up.meaning: To disturb or stir something violently (किसी चीज़ को जोरदार तरीके से हिला देना).
churn up.example: The storm churned up the sea.

clean down.meaning: To wash or clean something thoroughly (किसी चीज़ को अच्छी तरह से साफ करना).
clean down.example: After the game, the team cleaned down their equipment.

clam up.meaning: To suddenly stop talking, often due to nervousness (अचानक चुप हो जाना, आमतौर पर घबराहट के कारण).
clam up.example: He clammed up when the teacher asked about his homework.

clean out.meaning: To remove everything from a space or to steal everything (किसी स्थान को पूरी तरह से खाली करना या लूट लेना).
clean out.example: She cleaned out her closet and donated old clothes.

clamp down.meaning: To take strict action to stop something (किसी चीज़ को रोकने के लिए कड़ी कार्रवाई करना).
clamp down.example: The government is clamping down on illegal activities.

clean up.meaning: To make something tidy or remove dirt (किसी चीज़ को साफ-सुथरा बनाना).
clean up.example: She cleaned up the kitchen after dinner.

clap out.meaning: To be exhausted or worn out (बहुत थक जाना).
clap out.example: After running the marathon, he was completely clapped out.

claw back.meaning: To regain something with effort (कठिनाई से फिर से हासिल करना).
claw back.example: The company clawed back its market share after a tough year.

clean up after.meaning: To tidy up after someone else (किसी और के बाद सफाई करना).
clean up after.example: Parents often clean up after their children.

clear away.meaning: To remove or tidy up things (किसी चीज़ को हटा देना या साफ़ करना).
clear away.example: The waiter cleared away the empty plates.

clear up after.meaning: To clean or tidy a place after someone has made a mess (किसी के बाद जगह साफ करना).
clear up after.example: I always have to clear up after my little brother.

clear off.meaning: To go away quickly (जल्दी से चले जाना).
clear off.example: He told them to clear off from his property.

cleave to.meaning: To stick closely to something or remain loyal (किसी चीज़ से दृढ़ता से जुड़े रहना).
cleave to.example: She cleaved to her beliefs despite opposition.

clear out.meaning: To remove things or leave a place (किसी स्थान को खाली करना या छोड़ देना).
clear out.example: They cleared out the old furniture before moving in.

climb down.meaning: To admit a mistake or lower oneself from a high position (गलती स्वीकार करना या ऊँचाई से नीचे आना).
climb down.example: The politician had to climb down from his previous statement.

clear up.meaning: To make something clean, organized, or to resolve confusion (साफ करना, व्यवस्थित करना, या किसी समस्या का समाधान करना).
clear up.example: The weather cleared up in the afternoon.

clock in.meaning: To record the time of arrival at work (काम पर आने का समय दर्ज करना).
clock in.example: Employees must clock in before starting their shift.

clock off.meaning: To record the time of leaving work (काम से निकलने का समय दर्ज करना).
clock off.example: I clocked off at 6 PM today.

close off.meaning: To block or restrict access to a place (किसी स्थान को बंद कर देना).
close off.example: The police closed off the street due to an accident.

clock on.meaning: To officially start work by registering the time (औपचारिक रूप से काम शुरू करना).
clock on.example: She clocked on at exactly 9 AM.

clock up.meaning: To reach a particular amount or number (किसी विशेष संख्या या मात्रा तक पहुँचना).
clock up.example: She clocked up 10,000 steps on her fitness tracker today.

clog up.meaning: To block or slow down movement (किसी चीज़ को रोक देना या धीमा कर देना).
clog up.example: The sink got clogged up with food waste.

chose out.meaning: To select something from a group (एक समूह में से किसी चीज़ को चुनना).
chose out.example: She chose out the best dress for the party.

close on.meaning: To approach a particular amount or goal (किसी संख्या या लक्ष्य के करीब पहुँचना).
close on.example: The company is closing on a major deal.

close down.meaning: To shut a business or stop operations (किसी व्यवसाय को बंद कर देना).
close down.example: The factory closed down due to financial losses.

close in.meaning: To move closer in a threatening way (धमकी भरे अंदाज में पास आना).
close in.example: The police closed in on the suspect.

close up.meaning: To shut something completely (किसी चीज़ को पूरी तरह से बंद करना).
close up.example: The shop closes up at 9 PM.

clutch at.meaning: To grasp something tightly, often in desperation (किसी चीज़ को कसकर पकड़ना, आमतौर पर घबराहट में).
clutch at.example: He clutched at the railing to avoid falling.

coast along.meaning: To progress without much effort (बिना अधिक प्रयास के आगे बढ़ना).
coast along.example: He's just coasting along at work without taking on new responsibilities.

cloud over.meaning: To become covered with clouds or to look upset (बादलों से ढक जाना या परेशान दिखना).
cloud over.example: Her face clouded over when she heard the bad news.

cobble together.meaning: To put something together quickly, often without care (जल्दी-जल्दी कुछ तैयार करना, बिना ज्यादा ध्यान दिए).
cobble together.example: They cobbled together a temporary shelter with old wood.

clown about.meaning: To act in a silly or playful way (मूर्खतापूर्ण या मज़ेदार तरीके से व्यवहार करना).
clown about.example: The kids were clowning about in the playground.

cock up.meaning: To mess something up or make a mistake (कोई गलती करना या कुछ बिगाड़ देना).
cock up.example: He cocked up the whole presentation by forgetting his notes.

club together.meaning: To contribute money as a group for a shared purpose (सामूहिक रूप से पैसे जोड़ना).
club together.example: We clubbed together to buy a gift for our teacher.

color in.meaning: To fill a drawing with color (चित्र में रंग भरना).
color in.example: She colored in the picture with crayons.

clue in.meaning: To inform someone about something (किसी को किसी चीज़ की जानकारी देना).
clue in.example: She clued me in about the changes in the project.

color up.meaning: To become red in the face due to embarrassment or shyness (शर्म या संकोच के कारण लाल होना).
color up.example: She colored up when he complimented her.

come across with.meaning: To provide or deliver what is expected (अपेक्षित चीज़ प्रदान करना).
come across with.example: He finally came across with the payment.

comb out.meaning: To remove knots or tangles from hair or to search thoroughly (बालों की गाँठें खोलना या पूरी तरह से छानबीन करना).
comb out.example: She combed out her hair before the party.

come after.meaning: To follow or pursue someone (किसी का पीछा करना या उसके बाद आना).
come after.example: The police came after the thief.

come about.meaning: To happen or occur (घटित होना या होना).
come about.example: A big change came about in his life after college.

come along.meaning: To arrive, develop, or accompany someone (पहुँचना, विकसित होना, या किसी के साथ जाना).
come along.example: A great job opportunity came along last week.

come across.meaning: To find or encounter something unexpectedly (अचानक किसी चीज़ से सामना होना).
come across.example: I came across an old photo while cleaning my room.

come at.meaning: To attack or approach aggressively (आक्रामक रूप से हमला करना या आगे बढ़ना).
come at.example: The dog came at me, barking loudly.

come apart.meaning: To break into pieces or separate (टुकड़ों में टूट जाना या अलग हो जाना).
come apart.example: The old book came apart in my hands.

come around.meaning: To regain consciousness or change one's opinion (होश में आना या राय बदलना).
come around.example: He finally came around to my way of thinking.

come away.meaning: To leave a place with a particular feeling or result (किसी भावना या परिणाम के साथ किसी स्थान से जाना).
come away.example: I came away from the seminar feeling inspired.

come away with.meaning: To leave a place with something, often an impression or prize (किसी स्थान से किसी चीज़ को लेकर जाना).
come away with.example: She came away with a lot of new knowledge from the workshop.

come back.meaning: To return to a place or situation (वापस आना).
come back.example: He came back from his trip last night.

come by.meaning: To obtain or acquire something, often by chance (संयोग से कुछ प्राप्त करना).
come by.example: Good jobs are hard to come by these days.

come down.meaning: To fall, decrease, or move downward (गिरना, कम होना, या नीचे आना).
come down.example: The price of petrol has finally come down.

come back to.meaning: To return to a subject or thought (फिर से किसी विषय पर लौटना).
come back to.example: Let’s come back to this discussion later.

come before.meaning: To be more important than something else or to be presented to an authority (किसी और चीज़ से अधिक महत्वपूर्ण होना या किसी अधिकार के सामने आना).
come before.example: The case will come before the judge next week.

come between.meaning: To cause a separation or conflict (अलगाव या संघर्ष पैदा करना).
come between.example: Nothing will come between their friendship.

come forth.example: New evidence has come forth in the investigation.

come down on.meaning: To criticize or punish someone harshly (किसी की कड़ी आलोचना करना या दंड देना).
come down on.example: The teacher came down on the students for being late.

come down to.meaning: To be reduced to the most important point (आखिरकार किसी महत्वपूर्ण बिंदु पर आ जाना).
come down to.example: It all comes down to hard work and dedication.

come forth with.meaning: To offer or present something (कुछ प्रस्तुत करना).
come forth with.example: She came forth with a brilliant idea.

come down with.meaning: To become ill with a sickness (बीमार पड़ना).
come down with.example: I think I'm coming down with a cold.

come forward.meaning: To offer help, information, or to volunteer (सहायता, सूचना देने, या स्वयंसेवक बनने के लिए आगे आना).
come forward.example: Several witnesses came forward with important details.

come from.meaning: To originate from a place or source (किसी स्थान या स्रोत से आना).
come from.example: She comes from a small village in India.

come in.meaning: To enter a place or arrive (किसी स्थान में प्रवेश करना या पहुँचना).
come in.example: She knocked on the door and waited for someone to say ‘come in’.

come off.meaning: To happen successfully or as planned (सफल होना या योजना के अनुसार होना).
come off.example: His plan to start a business didn’t come off as expected.

come in for.meaning: To receive criticism or praise (आलोचना या प्रशंसा प्राप्त करना).
come in for.example: The government came in for a lot of criticism over its policies.

come into.meaning: To inherit something (विरासत में कुछ प्राप्त करना).
come into.example: She came into a large fortune after her grandfather passed away.

come on.meaning: To start functioning or progressing (शुरू होना या प्रगति करना).
come on.example: The lights came on automatically when it got dark.

come of.meaning: To be the result of something (किसी चीज़ का परिणाम होना).
come of.example: Nothing good will come of this argument.

come out.meaning: To become available, visible, or known (उपलब्ध, दिखाई देना, या ज्ञात होना).
come out.example: His new book is coming out next month.

come on to.meaning: To flirt with someone (किसी के प्रति आकर्षण प्रकट करना या छेड़खानी करना).
come on to.example: He was coming on to her at the party.

come out of.meaning: To result from a situation (किसी स्थिति से उत्पन्न होना).
come out of.example: A lot of good ideas came out of that meeting.

come out with.meaning: To say something suddenly or publish something (अचानक कुछ कहना या प्रकाशित करना).
come out with.example: She came out with a shocking statement.

come over.meaning: To visit someone’s place or move from one place to another (किसी के घर आना या एक स्थान से दूसरे स्थान पर जाना).
come over.example: Why don’t you come over for dinner?

come out in.meaning: To develop spots or a rash on the skin (त्वचा पर दाने या चकत्ते आना).
come out in.example: He came out in a rash after eating peanuts.

come through with.meaning: To provide or deliver something as promised (किसी वादे या अपेक्षा को पूरा करना).
come through with.example: He finally came through with the payment after weeks of delay.

come to.meaning: To regain consciousness or reach a decision (होश में आना या किसी निर्णय पर पहुँचना).
come to.example: She fainted but came to after a few minutes.

come through.meaning: To survive or succeed in a difficult situation (किसी कठिन स्थिति से निकलना या सफल होना).
come through.example: He came through the surgery without any complications.

come together.meaning: To unite or work together (एकजुट होना या साथ काम करना).
come together.example: The community came together to help the flood victims.

come under.meaning: To experience pressure, attack, or criticism (दबाव, हमले, या आलोचना का सामना करना).
come under.example: The company came under fire for its poor working conditions.

come up.meaning: To appear, arise, or be mentioned (सामने आना, उत्पन्न होना, या चर्चा में आना).
come up.example: A new opportunity has come up at work.

consist of.meaning: To be made up of something (किसी चीज़ से बना होना).
consist of.example: The team consists of five experienced players.

contend with.meaning: To deal with a difficult situation or challenge (किसी कठिनाई का सामना करना).
contend with.example: She had to contend with a lot of stress during her exams.

contract in.meaning: To formally agree to take part in something (किसी चीज़ में आधिकारिक रूप से भाग लेने के लिए सहमत होना).
contract in.example: The company contracted in several freelancers for the project.

cool down.meaning: To become calmer or less hot (शांत होना या ठंडा होना).
cool down.example: After the argument, he took a walk to cool down.

contract out.meaning: To arrange for someone else to do work instead of doing it oneself (काम को किसी और को सौंपना).
contract out.example: The company contracted out the IT services to an external firm.

contribute to.meaning: To help to cause an event or situation (किसी घटना या स्थिति में योगदान देना).
