contribute to.example: Regular exercise contributes to good health.

coop up.meaning: To confine someone in a small or restricted space (किसी को सीमित जगह में कैद करना).
coop up.example: The children felt cooped up inside the house during the lockdown.

cop off.meaning: To start a romantic or sexual relationship with someone (किसी के साथ रोमांटिक या शारीरिक संबंध शुरू करना).
cop off.example: He copped off with a girl at the party.

cook up.meaning: To invent a story, excuse, or plan, often dishonestly (कोई बहाना, योजना या कहानी बनाना, अक्सर धोखे से).
cook up.example: They cooked up an excuse to avoid punishment.

cop out.meaning: To avoid doing something difficult or taking responsibility (किसी कठिन चीज़ को करने से बचना या ज़िम्मेदारी से भागना).
cop out.example: He copped out of the project at the last moment.

copy down.meaning: To write down exactly what someone says or what is written (लिखकर उतारना).
copy down.example: The students copied down the notes from the board.

cotton to.meaning: To begin to like or accept something (किसी चीज़ को पसंद करना या अपनाना).
cotton to.example: She quickly cottoned to the idea of working remotely.

couch in.meaning: To express something in a particular way (किसी बात को एक विशेष तरीके से व्यक्त करना).
couch in.example: The request was couched in very polite language.

copy in.meaning: To send a copy of an email to someone (किसी को ईमेल की कॉपी भेजना).
copy in.example: Please copy me in on all project updates.

cough up.meaning: To give money unwillingly (अनिच्छा से पैसे देना).
cough up.example: He had to cough up a huge fine for parking illegally.

copy out.meaning: To write something exactly as it is written somewhere else (किसी चीज़ को हूबहू नकल करना).
copy out.example: She copied out the entire poem into her notebook.

cordon off.meaning: To block an area to prevent people from entering (किसी क्षेत्र को बंद करना ताकि लोग प्रवेश न कर सकें).
cordon off.example: The police cordoned off the crime scene.

count against.meaning: To be a disadvantage for someone (किसी के खिलाफ जाना या नुकसानदेह होना).
count against.example: His lack of experience counted against him in the job interview.

cosy up to.meaning: To try to be friendly with someone for personal advantage (स्वार्थ के लिए किसी के करीब आना).
cosy up to.example: He’s cosying up to the manager to get a promotion.

count among.meaning: To include someone or something as part of a group (किसी को किसी समूह में शामिल मानना).
count among.example: She counts among the best scientists in the country.

cotton on.meaning: To begin to understand something (धीरे-धीरे समझना).
cotton on.example: It took him a while to cotton on to the joke.

count down.meaning: To count backwards towards an event (किसी घटना के लिए उलटी गिनती करना).
count down.example: We are counting down the days until the holiday.

count out.meaning: To exclude someone or something (किसी को बाहर करना).
count out.example: If you’re playing football, count me out!

count for.meaning: To have value or importance (मायने रखना या महत्व होना).
count for.example: Hard work counts for a lot in this job.

count towards.meaning: To be included as part of something (किसी चीज़ में शामिल किया जाना).
count towards.example: These credits count towards your final grade.

count in.meaning: To include someone in an activity (किसी को किसी गतिविधि में शामिल करना).
count in.example: We are going to the party, count me in!

count up.meaning: To add numbers together to find a total (कुल जोड़ना).
count up.example: She counted up the votes to find the winner.

count off.meaning: To say numbers in order while people or things are being counted (संख्या गिनते समय लोगों या चीजों की गिनती करना).
count off.example: The soldiers counted off before starting the drill.

couple with.meaning: To combine with something else (किसी अन्य चीज़ के साथ जुड़ना).
couple with.example: High inflation, coupled with job losses, has created economic instability.

count on.meaning: To rely on someone or something (किसी पर निर्भर रहना).
count on.example: You can always count on me for help.

cover for.meaning: To do someone’s work or take their place temporarily (किसी के काम को अस्थायी रूप से करना).
cover for.example: She covered for her colleague while he was on leave.

cover over.meaning: To place something over something else to hide or protect it (किसी चीज़ को ढकना).
cover over.example: He covered over the hole with a wooden plank.

cover up.meaning: To hide the truth about something (सच्चाई को छिपाना).
cover up.example: The company tried to cover up the financial scandal.

crack up.meaning: To burst into laughter or to suffer from a mental breakdown (तेज़ी से हंसना या मानसिक रूप से टूटना).
crack up.example: The joke was so funny that I cracked up.

cozy up to.meaning: To try to become friendly with someone for personal gain (स्वार्थ के लिए किसी के करीब जाना).
cozy up to.example: He’s trying to cozy up to the boss for a promotion.

crack down.meaning: To take severe action against something (किसी चीज़ के खिलाफ सख्त कार्रवाई करना).
crack down.example: The government is cracking down on illegal activities.

crack on.meaning: To continue working hard on something (किसी काम को तेजी से जारी रखना).
crack on.example: We need to crack on if we want to meet the deadline.

cram in.meaning: To try to fit a lot of things into a short period or small space (थोड़े समय या जगह में बहुत कुछ समाने की कोशिश करना).
cram in.example: She crammed in as much studying as possible before the exam.

crank out.meaning: To produce something quickly and in large amounts (तेजी से और बड़ी मात्रा में कुछ बनाना).
crank out.example: The factory cranks out thousands of phones every day.

crank up.meaning: To increase the intensity or power of something (किसी चीज़ की तीव्रता या शक्ति बढ़ाना).
crank up.example: They cranked up the volume on the speakers.

crease up.meaning: To start laughing a lot (बहुत ज्यादा हंसना).
crease up.example: The comedian's joke made everyone crease up.

credit with.meaning: To acknowledge someone for an achievement (किसी को उपलब्धि के लिए श्रेय देना).
credit with.example: He is credited with inventing the telephone.

creep in.meaning: To gradually appear or become noticeable (धीरे-धीरे दिखाई देना या महसूस होना).
creep in.example: Errors began to creep in as they rushed the project.

crap on.meaning: To talk negatively about someone or something (किसी की बुराई करना).
crap on.example: He always craps on his boss behind his back.

crash out.meaning: To fall asleep suddenly (अचानक सो जाना).
crash out.example: After the long trip, he crashed out on the couch.

crawl with.meaning: To be full of something, especially moving things (किसी चीज़ से भरा होना, खासकर जीव-जंतुओं से).
crawl with.example: The kitchen was crawling with ants.

cream off.meaning: To take the best part or people from a group (किसी समूह से सबसे अच्छा हिस्सा या लोग लेना).
cream off.example: Elite universities tend to cream off the best students.

creep over.meaning: To gradually spread or take over (धीरे-धीरे फैलना).
creep over.example: A feeling of unease crept over him as he entered the house.

creep up on.meaning: To approach someone quietly and unnoticed (किसी के पास चुपके से आना).
creep up on.example: Old age creeps up on you before you know it.

crop up.example: A few problems cropped up during the project.

cross up.meaning: To confuse or mislead someone (किसी को भ्रमित करना).
cross up.example: The tricky question crossed up many students.

crowd around.meaning: To gather closely around someone or something (किसी के चारों ओर इकट्ठा होना).
crowd around.example: The fans crowded around the celebrity for autographs.

cross off.meaning: To remove someone or something from a list (सूची से किसी को हटाना).
cross off.example: I crossed off the items I had already bought.

crowd in.meaning: To come together in a small space (छोटी जगह में इकट्ठा होना).
crowd in.example: The students crowded in to see the experiment.

cross out.meaning: To draw a line through something to show it is incorrect (गलत दिखाने के लिए रेखा खींचना).
cross out.example: He crossed out the wrong answer on his test.

cross over.meaning: To change from one thing to another or move from one side to another (एक चीज़ से दूसरी में बदलना या पार करना).
cross over.example: The singer crossed over from country music to pop.

crowd out.meaning: To force someone or something out due to lack of space (जगह की कमी के कारण किसी को बाहर करना).
crowd out.example: New businesses are crowding out small local shops.

crumple up.meaning: To crush something into a small ball (किसी चीज़ को छोटा और मुड़ा हुआ बना देना).
crumple up.example: He crumpled up the paper and threw it away.

culminate in.meaning: To reach the highest point or final stage of something (किसी चीज़ के उच्चतम बिंदु या अंतिम चरण तक पहुंचना).
culminate in.example: The argument culminated in a heated debate.

cry off.meaning: To cancel a plan or promise (कोई योजना या वादा रद्द करना).
cry off.example: She cried off at the last minute due to illness.

cry out.meaning: To make a loud sound due to fear, pain, or excitement (डर, दर्द, या उत्साह में ज़ोर से चिल्लाना).
cry out.example: She cried out in pain when she fell.

cry out against.meaning: To protest strongly against something (किसी चीज़ के खिलाफ ज़ोरदार विरोध करना).
cry out against.example: The citizens cried out against the new tax laws.

curse with.meaning: To be afflicted or troubled with something unpleasant (किसी अप्रिय चीज़ से पीड़ित होना).
curse with.example: He was cursed with bad luck throughout his life.

curl up.meaning: To sit or lie in a comfortable curved position (आराम से गोल मुद्रा में बैठना या लेटना).
curl up.example: She curled up on the sofa with a book.

cry out for.meaning: To urgently need or demand something (किसी चीज़ की तत्काल आवश्यकता होना).
cry out for.example: This house is crying out for renovation.

cuss out.meaning: To angrily insult or swear at someone (गुस्से में किसी को गाली देना).
cuss out.example: He cussed out the driver who cut him off.

cuddle up.meaning: To sit or lie close to someone or something for warmth or comfort (आराम या गर्मी के लिए किसी के करीब बैठना या लेटना).
cuddle up.example: She cuddled up with her cat on the couch.

cull from.meaning: To select or gather something from a larger source (किसी बड़ी स्रोत से कुछ चुनना या इकट्ठा करना).
cull from.example: The best ideas were culled from various research papers.

cut across.meaning: To go through an area instead of following the usual route (आम रास्ते के बजाय छोटे रास्ते से जाना).
cut across.example: We cut across the park to save time.

cut back.meaning: To reduce the amount of something (किसी चीज़ की मात्रा को कम करना).
cut back.example: The company cut back on expenses due to financial issues.

cut down.meaning: To reduce something or make it smaller (किसी चीज़ को कम करना या छोटा बनाना).
cut down.example: He cut down on sugar to lose weight.

cut in.meaning: To interrupt someone who is speaking or to suddenly move in front of another vehicle (बातचीत में बाधा डालना या गाड़ी के आगे अचानक आना).
cut in.example: She cut in while I was explaining my point.

cut off.meaning: To stop the supply of something or to disconnect (किसी चीज़ की आपूर्ति रोकना या कनेक्शन काट देना).
cut off.example: The phone service was cut off due to non-payment.

cut into.meaning: To reduce the amount of something or to penetrate (किसी चीज़ की मात्रा को कम करना या उसमें प्रवेश करना).
cut into.example: Working extra hours cut into his family time.

cut out.meaning: To remove something or stop doing something (किसी चीज़ को हटाना या करना बंद करना).
cut out.example: She cut out junk food from her diet.

cut out for.meaning: To be suited for a particular task or role (किसी विशेष कार्य या भूमिका के लिए उपयुक्त होना).
cut out for.example: He is cut out for a career in acting.

cut through.meaning: To go through something quickly or directly to save time (किसी चीज़ के बीच से जल्दी या सीधे रास्ते से जाना).
cut through.example: We cut through the alley to reach the station faster.

cut up.meaning: To chop something into small pieces or to behave in a silly way (किसी चीज़ को छोटे टुकड़ों में काटना या मज़ाकिया ढंग से व्यवहार करना).
cut up.example: She cut up the vegetables for the salad.

accept.meaning: To agree to take or receive something offered (स्वीकार करना).
accept.example: She was happy to accept the job offer.

abandon.meaning: To leave something or someone behind permanently (त्याग देना).
abandon.example: They had to abandon the project due to lack of funds.

achieve.meaning: To successfully reach a goal or objective (प्राप्त करना).
achieve.example: She worked hard to achieve her dreams.

adapt.meaning: To adjust to new conditions (अनुकूल बनाना).
adapt.example: Animals adapt to their environment to survive.

admire.meaning: To regard with respect or warm approval (प्रशंसा करना).
admire.example: I admire her dedication to her work.

admit.meaning: To confess or acknowledge something (स्वीकार करना).
admit.example: He admitted his mistake and apologized.

affect.meaning: To influence or have an impact on something (प्रभाव डालना).
affect.example: The weather can affect our mood.

agree.meaning: To have the same opinion as someone else (सहमत होना).
agree.example: They agreed on the terms of the contract.

allow.meaning: To permit something to happen or someone to do something (अनुमति देना).
allow.example: The teacher does not allow students to use phones in class.

amaze.meaning: To surprise or impress someone greatly (चकित करना).
amaze.example: Her talent amazes everyone in the audience.

analyze.meaning: To examine something in detail (विश्लेषण करना).
analyze.example: Scientists analyze data to find patterns.

announce.meaning: To make a formal public statement (घोषणा करना).
announce.example: The company announced a new product launch.

answer.meaning: To respond to a question (उत्तर देना).
answer.example: She answered the teacher’s question correctly.

apologize.meaning: To express regret for an action (माफी मांगना).

apply.meaning: To make a formal request for something (आवेदन करना).

appreciate.meaning: To recognize the value of something (सराहना करना).
appreciate.example: I appreciate your help with this project.

arrange.meaning: To organize or put in order (व्यवस्थित करना).
arrange.example: She arranged the books neatly on the shelf.

arrive.example: The guests arrived at the party on time.

ask.meaning: To put a question to someone (पूछना).
ask.example: He asked the teacher about the homework assignment.

assign.meaning: To give someone a task or duty (सौंपना).
assign.example: The teacher assigned homework to the class.

assist.meaning: To help or support someone (सहायता करना).
assist.example: The nurse assisted the doctor in surgery.

assume.meaning: To take for granted without proof (मान लेना).
assume.example: She assumed he would be at the meeting.

attach.meaning: To connect or fasten something (संलग्न करना).
attach.example: Please attach the document to the email.

attract.meaning: To draw interest or attention (आकर्षित करना).

abbreviated.meaning: Shortened in length or duration (संक्षिप्त किया हुआ).
abbreviated.example: The speech was abbreviated due to time constraints.

ability.meaning: The power or skill to do something (क्षमता).
ability.example: She has the ability to solve complex problems.

abridge.meaning: To shorten a text without losing its main meaning (संक्षिप्त करना).
abridge.example: The book was abridged for younger readers.

abscond.meaning: To leave hurriedly and secretly, often to avoid arrest (फरार होना).
abscond.example: The thief tried to abscond with the stolen jewels.

absolve.meaning: To declare someone free from guilt or blame (निर्दोष ठहराना).
absolve.example: The judge absolved him of all charges.

absorb.meaning: To soak up or take in (शोषण करना).
absorb.example: The sponge can absorb a large amount of water.

abstain.meaning: To refrain from doing something (परहेज करना).
abstain.example: He decided to abstain from alcohol for health reasons.

abstract.meaning: Existing in thought or as an idea but not having a physical existence (सार).
abstract.example: Her paintings are highly abstract and open to interpretation.

absurd.example: It is absurd to expect a baby to read a book.

accentuate.meaning: To emphasize or highlight something (प्रमुख बनाना).
accentuate.example: The designer used lighting to accentuate the beauty of the sculpture.

acceptable.meaning: Satisfactory and able to be agreed upon (स्वीकार्य).
acceptable.example: The proposal was found to be acceptable by the committee.

acceptance.meaning: The act of agreeing or approving something (स्वीकृति).
acceptance.example: Her acceptance into the university made her parents proud.

access.meaning: The ability to enter or use something (पहुँच).
access.example: Only authorized personnel have access to the laboratory.

accommodate.meaning: To provide space or fulfill someone's needs (समायोजित करना).
accommodate.example: The hotel can accommodate up to 500 guests.

accommodation.meaning: A place to stay or an arrangement to meet needs (आवास).
accommodation.example: They booked their accommodation near the beach.

accomplice.meaning: A person who helps someone commit a crime (सहयोगी अपराधी).
accomplice.example: The robber’s accomplice was caught by the police.

accomplish.meaning: To successfully complete a task (पूरा करना).
accomplish.example: She was determined to accomplish her goals.

accord.meaning: An agreement or harmony between people or groups (समझौता).
accord.example: The two countries signed a peace accord.

accost.meaning: To approach and speak to someone aggressively (सामना करना).
accost.example: The journalist was accosted by an angry protester.

account.meaning: A report or record of financial transactions or events (खाता / विवरण).
account.example: She gave a detailed account of what happened at the event.

accuracy.meaning: The quality of being correct and precise (शुद्धता).
accuracy.example: The scientist checked the accuracy of the experiment results.

accurate.meaning: Free from errors; exact and correct (सटीक).
accurate.example: Her answer was accurate and well-explained.

acknowledge.meaning: To accept or recognize something as true or valid (स्वीकार करना).
acknowledge.example: She refused to acknowledge her mistake.

acquire.meaning: To gain or obtain something (अर्जित करना).
acquire.example: He acquired new skills through practice.

acquisition.meaning: The act of gaining possession of something (अधिग्रहण).
acquisition.example: The company's acquisition of new technology improved efficiency.

acrimony.meaning: Bitterness or harshness in speech or behavior (कटुता).
acrimony.example: Their divorce was filled with acrimony and conflict.

acute.meaning: Sharp or severe in effect; intense (तीव्र).
acute.example: She felt acute pain in her shoulder after the accident.

adept.example: She is adept at solving complex math problems.

adhere.meaning: To stick to or follow something strictly (पालन करना).
adhere.example: Students should adhere to the school rules.

adjudicate.meaning: To make a formal decision about a dispute (निर्णय देना).
adjudicate.example: The court will adjudicate the case next week.

admirable.example: Her dedication to social work is admirable.

adorn.meaning: To decorate or enhance the beauty of something (सजाना).
adorn.example: The hall was adorned with beautiful lights for the wedding.

agreement.meaning: A mutual understanding or arrangement between two or more parties (समझौता).
agreement.example: Both sides reached an agreement after long negotiations.

ailment.meaning: A minor illness or health disorder (बीमारी).
ailment.example: She was suffering from a minor ailment and took some rest.

alacrity.meaning: Eagerness or willingness to do something quickly (तत्परता).
alacrity.example: She accepted the invitation with alacrity.

alchemy.meaning: A medieval practice of transforming matter, often linked to magic (रसविद्या).
alchemy.example: Ancient scholars believed in the alchemy of turning lead into gold.

alienate.meaning: To make someone feel isolated or unwelcome (दूर कर देना).
alienate.example: His rude behavior alienated him from his colleagues.

ally.meaning: A person or country that helps or supports another (मित्र).
ally.example: The two nations became allies during the war.

alter.meaning: To change or modify something (बदलाव करना).
alter.example: He altered his diet to lose weight.

although.meaning: Used to introduce a contrast between two ideas (हालांकि).
although.example: Although it was raining, they went for a walk.

altruism.meaning: Selfless concern for the well-being of others (परोपकारिता).
altruism.example: His altruism was evident in his charitable work.

ambiguous.meaning: Having more than one possible meaning; unclear (अस्पष्ट).
ambiguous.example: His answer was ambiguous and left everyone confused.

ambivalence.meaning: Mixed or contradictory feelings about something (द्विधा भाव).
ambivalence.example: She felt ambivalence about moving to a new city.

amenity.meaning: A feature that makes a place more comfortable or pleasant (सुविधा).
amenity.example: The hotel offers many amenities, including a gym and a swimming pool.

Babble.meaning: To talk rapidly and continuously in a foolish or excited way (बकबक करना).

Back.meaning: To support or endorse something or someone (समर्थन करना).
Back.example: She backed her friend in the argument.

Backfire.meaning: To have the opposite result of what was intended (उल्टा असर डालना).
Backfire.example: His plan to trick his rival backfired.

Backtrack.meaning: To reverse one's position or go back on a previous decision (वापस जाना).
Backtrack.example: He backtracked on his earlier promise.

Badger.meaning: To repeatedly ask someone for something or persuade them (तंग करना).
Badger.example: The child badgered his mother for a toy.

Baffle.meaning: To confuse or perplex someone (हक्का-बक्का करना).

Bake.meaning: To cook food using dry heat, especially in an oven (सेंकना).
Bake.example: She baked a delicious cake for the party.

Balance.meaning: To keep something steady or in equilibrium (संतुलन बनाना).
Balance.example: She balanced the books on her head.

Balk.meaning: To hesitate or be unwilling to accept something (हिचकिचाना).
Balk.example: He balked at the high price of the car.

Ball.meaning: To form something into a round shape (गेंद बनाना).
Ball.example: He balled up the piece of paper.

Ballot.meaning: To vote in an election (मतदान करना).
Ballot.example: The committee balloted for a new leader.

Bamboozle.meaning: To trick or deceive someone (चालाकी से बेवकूफ बनाना).
Bamboozle.example: The magician bamboozled the audience with his tricks.

Ban.example: The government banned smoking in public places.

Bandage.meaning: To cover a wound with a protective dressing (पट्टी बांधना).

Bang.meaning: To strike or hit something forcefully (ठोकर मारना).
Bang.example: He banged the door shut in anger.

Banish.meaning: To send someone away as punishment (निर्वासित करना).
Banish.example: The king banished the traitor from the kingdom.

Bank.meaning: To deposit or manage money in a financial institution (बैंक में जमा करना).
Bank.example: She banks with a major national institution.

Bargain.meaning: To negotiate for a better deal or price (मोलभाव करना).
Bargain.example: He bargained with the shopkeeper over the price.

Bark.meaning: To make a loud, sharp noise like a dog (भौंकना).
Bark.example: The dog barked loudly at the stranger.

Calculate.example: She can quickly calculate the total cost.

Call.meaning: To say something in a loud voice or contact someone via phone (बुलाना, फोन करना).
Call.example: He decided to call his friend after work.

Calm.meaning: To make someone or something peaceful and quiet (शांत करना).
Calm.example: The music helped calm her nerves.

Camp.meaning: To set up temporary accommodation outdoors (शिविर लगाना).
Camp.example: We decided to camp near the river.

Cancel.meaning: To decide that an event will not happen (रद्द करना).
Cancel.example: They had to cancel the meeting due to bad weather.

Capture.meaning: To take or seize by force or skill (पकड़ना).
Capture.example: The police managed to capture the thief.

Care.meaning: To feel concern or interest (ध्यान रखना, परवाह करना).
Care.example: She takes great care of her plants.

Carry.meaning: To hold and move something from one place to another (ले जाना).
Carry.example: He can carry two bags at once.

Carve.meaning: To cut something into a specific shape (काटना, तराशना).
Carve.example: He carved his name into the wood.

Catch.meaning: To grab or seize something in motion (पकड़ना).
Catch.example: She managed to catch the ball before it hit the ground.

Cause.example: Smoking can cause serious health problems.

Celebrate.meaning: To acknowledge an event with enjoyment (जश्न मनाना).
Celebrate.example: We celebrate Diwali with great enthusiasm.

Challenge.meaning: To invite someone to compete or question something (चुनौती देना).
Challenge.example: She decided to challenge the results of the election.

Change.meaning: To make or become different (बदलाव करना).
Change.example: He changed his hairstyle last week.

Charge.meaning: To ask for a price or to accuse someone (मूल्य वसूलना, आरोप लगाना).

Chase.meaning: To run after someone or something (पीछा करना).
Chase.example: The dog chased the cat across the yard.

Chat.meaning: To talk casually with someone (बातचीत करना).
Chat.example: They chatted over coffee for hours.

Cheer.meaning: To shout in support or happiness (उत्साहित करना).
Cheer.example: The crowd cheered loudly after the victory.

Choose.example: She chose the blue dress for the party.

Chop.example: He chopped the onions finely before cooking.

Claim.meaning: To state something as true or demand something (दावा करना).
Claim.example: He claimed that he had never seen the missing document.

Clarify.meaning: To make something clear or easier to understand (स्पष्ट करना).
Clarify.example: She asked the teacher to clarify the topic.

Clash.meaning: To fight or disagree strongly (टकराव होना).
Clash.example: The two teams clashed during the final match.

Clean.meaning: To remove dirt or impurities (साफ करना).
Clean.example: She cleaned the kitchen before cooking.

Clear.meaning: To remove obstacles or doubts (स्पष्ट करना, हटाना).
Clear.example: He cleared his doubts before the exam.

Climb.example: They climbed the mountain early in the morning.

Cling.example: The baby clung to his mother's hand.

Collapse.meaning: To fall down suddenly (गिर जाना, ढह जाना).
Collapse.example: The building collapsed during the earthquake.

Collect.example: She collects stamps as a hobby.

Collide.example: The two cars collided at the intersection.

Color.meaning: To add color to something (रंग भरना).

Combat.meaning: To fight or struggle against something (लड़ना, संघर्ष करना).
Combat.example: The government is taking measures to combat pollution.

Combine.meaning: To mix or join things together (मिलाना, जोड़ना).
Combine.example: She combined different ingredients to make a new dish.

Comfort.meaning: To make someone feel better (सांत्वना देना, आराम देना).
Comfort.example: She comforted her friend after the bad news.

Command.example: The officer commanded the soldiers to move forward.

Comment.meaning: To express an opinion about something (टिप्पणी करना).
Comment.example: She commented on the beautiful painting.

Commit.meaning: To promise or dedicate oneself to something (समर्पित होना, संकल्प लेना).
Commit.example: He committed to completing the project on time.

Communicate.meaning: To share information with others (संचार करना).
Communicate.example: They communicate through emails and phone calls.

Compare.meaning: To examine similarities and differences (तुलना करना).
Compare.example: She compared the prices before buying the dress.

Compete.meaning: To take part in a contest (प्रतिस्पर्धा करना).
Compete.example: Many athletes competed in the championship.

Complain.meaning: To express dissatisfaction or annoyance about something (शिकायत करना).
Complain.example: She complained about the poor service at the restaurant.

Complete.example: He completed his project before the deadline.

Comprehend.example: She struggled to comprehend the difficult concept.

Conceal.meaning: To hide or keep something secret (छुपाना).
Conceal.example: He tried to conceal his nervousness.

Concede.meaning: To admit something is true after initially denying it (स्वीकार करना).
Concede.example: The losing team conceded defeat gracefully.

Concentrate.example: She concentrated on her studies for the exam.

Concern.meaning: To worry or care about something (चिंता करना).

Conclude.meaning: To bring something to an end (निष्कर्ष निकालना).
Conclude.example: The meeting concluded after two hours.

Condemn.meaning: To express strong disapproval of something (निंदा करना).
Condemn.example: The government condemned the violent protests.

Conduct.meaning: To organize and carry out an activity (संचालित करना).
Conduct.example: The scientist conducted an experiment in the lab.

Confess.meaning: To admit to something, usually a wrongdoing (स्वीकार करना).
Confess.example: He confessed to stealing the money.

Confirm.meaning: To establish something as true or correct (पुष्टि करना).

Confuse.meaning: To make someone unsure or unable to understand (भ्रमित करना).
Confuse.example: The complicated instructions confused the students.

Connect.meaning: To join or link things together (जोड़ना).
Connect.example: She connected the laptop to the Wi-Fi.

Conquer.meaning: To defeat or take control of something (विजय प्राप्त करना).
Conquer.example: The army conquered the enemy territory.

Conserve.meaning: To protect something from harm or destruction (संरक्षित करना).
Conserve.example: We should conserve water to prevent shortages.

Consider.meaning: To think about something carefully (विचार करना).
Consider.example: She considered all options before making a decision.

Consist.meaning: To be made up of different elements (बना होना).
Consist.example: The dish consists of rice and vegetables.

Console.meaning: To comfort someone who is upset or sad (सांत्वना देना).
Console.example: She consoled her friend after the bad news.

Conspire.meaning: To plan secretly with others to do something wrong (षड्यंत्र रचना).
Conspire.example: The criminals conspired to rob the bank.

Construct.meaning: To build or create something (निर्माण करना).
Construct.example: They constructed a new bridge over the river.

Consult.meaning: To seek advice or information from someone (परामर्श करना).
Consult.example: He consulted a doctor about his health issue.

Consume.meaning: To use up or eat something (खपत करना, खाना).
Consume.example: The fire consumed the entire building.

Contact.example: You can contact me via email.

Contain.meaning: To hold or have something inside (समाहित करना).
Contain.example: The bottle contains one liter of water.

Contemplate.meaning: To think deeply about something (चिंतन करना).
Contemplate.example: He contemplated his future career choices.

Continue.example: She continued her studies despite difficulties.

Contract.meaning: To shrink or make an agreement (सिकुड़ना, अनुबंध करना).
Contract.example: The metal contracts in cold temperatures.

Contrast.meaning: To compare two things to highlight differences (विरोधाभास दिखाना).
Contrast.example: She contrasted the two paintings to show their uniqueness.

Contribute.meaning: To give something, such as money or effort, to help achieve a goal (योगदान देना).
Contribute.example: She contributed money to the charity.

Control.meaning: To have power over something or someone (नियंत्रण करना).
Control.example: He controlled his emotions during the argument.

Convert.meaning: To change from one form to another (परिवर्तित करना).
Convert.example: She converted the file into a different format.

Convey.meaning: To communicate or express something (संचारित करना).
Convey.example: He conveyed his feelings through a letter.

Convince.meaning: To persuade someone to do or believe something (मनाना, विश्वास दिलाना).
Convince.example: She convinced her parents to let her travel alone.

Cook.meaning: To prepare food by heating (खाना बनाना).
Cook.example: She cooked a delicious meal for dinner.

Cooperate.meaning: To work together towards a common goal (सहयोग करना).
Cooperate.example: The team cooperated to complete the project.

Coordinate.meaning: To organize activities or tasks efficiently (समन्वय करना).

Copy.meaning: To duplicate or imitate something (नकल करना).
Copy.example: He copied the notes from his friend's book.

Correct.example: She corrected the spelling mistakes in her essay.

Correspond.meaning: To communicate or match with something (संबंध रखना, पत्राचार करना).
Correspond.example: Their statements did not correspond with the facts.

Cost.meaning: To require payment or effort (कीमत लगना).
Cost.example: The new phone costs a lot of money.

Counsel.meaning: To give advice or guidance (सलाह देना).
Counsel.example: The lawyer counseled his client before the trial.

Count.meaning: To determine the number of something (गिनना).
Count.example: She counted the number of apples in the basket.

Cover.meaning: To place something over another to protect or hide it (ढंकना).
Cover.example: He covered his face with a scarf.

Crack.meaning: To break without completely separating (दरार पड़ना).
Crack.example: The mirror cracked when it fell.

Craft.meaning: To create something skillfully (कौशल से बनाना).
Craft.example: She crafted a beautiful handmade card.

Crash.meaning: To collide violently or stop working suddenly (टकराना, गिरना).
Crash.example: The car crashed into the wall.

Crawl.meaning: To move slowly on hands and knees (रेंगना).
Crawl.example: The baby crawled across the floor.

Creep.meaning: To move slowly and quietly (धीरे-धीरे चलना).
Creep.example: The cat crept up on the mouse.

Criticize.meaning: To point out faults or shortcomings (आलोचना करना).
Criticize.example: He criticized the movie for its poor script.

Cross.meaning: To go from one side to another (पार करना).

Crush.meaning: To press something with force until it breaks (कुचलना).
Crush.example: He crushed the empty can in his hand.

Cry.meaning: To shed tears as an expression of emotion (रोना).
Cry.example: The child cried after falling down.

Cultivate.meaning: To prepare land for farming or to develop a skill (खेती करना, विकसित करना).
Cultivate.example: He cultivated wheat on his farm.

Cure.meaning: To heal or make someone healthy (इलाज करना).
Cure.example: The doctor cured the patient's illness.

Cut.meaning: To divide something with a sharp tool (काटना).
Cut.example: She cut the paper into small pieces.

Cycle.meaning: To ride a bicycle or repeat in a pattern (साइकिल चलाना, चक्र पूरा करना).
Cycle.example: He cycles to work every day.

Apple.example: She ate a fresh apple for breakfast.

Mango.example: Mango is my favorite summer fruit.

Orange.example: Oranges are rich in Vitamin C.

Grapes.example: She bought a bunch of grapes from the market.

Watermelon.example: Watermelon is perfect for hot summer days.

Guava.example: Guavas are rich in fiber and vitamins.

Strawberry.example: Strawberries are used to make delicious desserts.

Peach.example: Peaches are delicious when eaten fresh.

Plum.example: She picked a ripe plum from the tree.

Pomegranate.example: Pomegranates are good for heart health.

Kiwi.example: Kiwi is a great source of Vitamin C.

Cherry.example: Cherries are often used in cakes and desserts.

Fig.example: Dried figs are a healthy snack.

Dragon Fruit.example: Dragon fruit is popular in smoothies.

Jackfruit.example: Jackfruit is used as a meat substitute in vegan dishes.

Mulberry.example: Mulberries are used in jams and syrups.

Custard Apple.example: Custard apples are very sweet and tasty.

Raspberry.example: Raspberries are often used in desserts.

Starfruit.example: Starfruit has a tangy and slightly sweet flavor.

Persimmon.example: Persimmons taste best when they are fully ripe.

Gooseberry.example: Gooseberries are rich in Vitamin C.
